Finance Data Analyst

Location: Chertsey (Flexible/Hybrid Working Available)
About Foodbuy Group

Foodbuy Group is one of the UK’s leading food procurement organisations, managing over £1.5 billion in spend annually. We unite foodservice and hospitality clients to deliver expert procurement solutions that save time and money.

As part of Compass Group UK & Ireland—our parent company and biggest client—we work directly with manufacturers and growers. Our extensive supplier network includes the industry’s most recognised brands alongside trusted regional and local providers. With a team of 200+ procurement professionals, our unrivalled scale and data-driven insights set us apart.
The Role: Finance Data Analyst

We’re looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Finance Data Analyst to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and efficiency of our financial data and processes. In this role, you'll play a key part in ensuring robust controls are in place and that management information is complete, accurate, and actionable.

You’ll be working with large volumes of data from multiple sources, so previous experience managing and interpreting complex datasets is essential. You’ll also collaborate closely with internal teams and external stakeholders to support financial reporting, commercial modelling, and performance tracking.
Key Responsibilities:
• Support the preparation of reports on current and historical activity, including all month-end and post-month-end financial activities.
• Provide product-level analysis to investigate discrepancies and support strategic decision-making.
• Build strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including Procurement, Sourcing, and Finance teams.
• Track and report on supplier/manufacturer data, including rebates and pricing.
• Understand and manage multiple data sources and how they interconnect.
• Analyse complex commercial rebate and pricing structures, summarising insights for a range of audiences (Finance, Account Management, Suppliers, and Clients).
• Ensure a clear understanding of our business’s commercial model and how procurement deals are integrated.
• Take ownership of the accuracy, relevance, and auditing of your own data outputs.

What We’re Looking For:

Essential:
• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
• Strong analytical, numerical, and problem-solving abilities.
• Meticulous attention to detail with a commitment to data accuracy.
• Proven ability to manage and interpret complex data sets.
• Strong communication skills—both written and verbal.
• Ability to work independently under pressure and meet deadlines.

Desirable:
• Solid organisational skills and a proactive mindset.
• Confidence in making informed, data-led decisions.
• Experience working with databases and manual data feeds; SQL proficiency is advantageous.
• Exposure to systems such as SQL (Access), SAP, and other finance/data tools.

What’s In It for You?

At Foodbuy, we invest in our people. Here’s what you can expect:
• Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
• Contributory pension scheme
• Career development via tailored learning programmes and progression pathways
• Access to a Digital GP and wider health & wellbeing benefits
• Exclusive savings with top retailers and travel companies
• Free access to mindfulness, exercise, and wellness sessions
• Discount perks extended to friends and family

Ready to Join Us?

If you're excited to take on a role where data and finance drive impactful decisions in a dynamic supply chain environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and become part of a forward-thinking team shaping the future of food procurement.

Job Title: Paid Internship in Data Analytics - Leeds, United Kingdom
Job Description:
```html Company Description

Join a leading international firm based in Leeds, renowned for its innovative approaches in data analytics and transformative solutions. This company is at the forefront of technology and market insights, consistently delivering high-quality services to clients across various industries. With a commitment to professional growth and a dynamic work environment, interns will benefit from mentorship, hands-on experience, and exposure to cutting-edge analytics tools.
Internship Overview

We are seeking a motivated Data Analytics Intern to join our talented team. The intern will support data-driven decisions through analysis, reporting, and visualization, contributing to impactful projects that shape business strategies.

• Assist in gathering, cleaning, and analyzing large datasets to identify trends and insights.
```

Salt are proud to collaborate once again with one of our biggest agency clients as they seek to hire a data-driven Social Listening Analyst to join their team and play a critical role in analysing the performance of their social media activity. In this ASAP starting contract role, you will be responsible for tracking, reporting, and deriving insights from social data to optimise content, campaigns, and overall strategy.

This role is ideal for someone passionate about social media, analytics, and storytelling through data. This role will work across two client accounts. Strong Communication skills are essential for this position as this role will be client facing.

This is a part-time role, 2-3days per week. Ideally hybrid to London HQ.

Role Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain social media reporting dashboards.
• Analyse engagement, reach, sentiment, and campaign impact across platforms.
• Translate social data into actionable insights to inform content and strategy.
• Monitor competitor activity and industry benchmarks.
• Collaborate with content and media teams to evaluate performance and test new formats.
• Support brand lift studies, influencer performance tracking, and paid/organic reporting.

Key Requirements
• Experience in social media analytics, insights, or a related role.
• Experience in building social measurement framework.
• Proficiency with tools like Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, or native platform analytics.
• Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. Datarama, Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
• Solid understanding of social KPIs and how they ladder up to business goals.
• Attention to detail and ability to turn numbers into compelling stories.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Terrascope is seeking a Carbon Data Analyst in London to support clients in measuring and reducing carbon emissions using their decarbonisation SaaS platform. The role involves collaborating with Customer Success Managers, transforming data for carbon footprint calculations, and advising on emissions reduction strategies. The position reports to the Head of Sustainability and requires adherence to international carbon accounting standards.
Empowering enterprises to keep the planet habitable for all!

Reversing the impact of climate change is one of the world’s biggest challenges. And businesses have a responsibility to lead the way. While individual consumer choices are important, over 80% of all the emissions reductions necessary for the world to reach Net-Zero, require business-level action. But despite the growing momentum and ambition from companies around the world to set Net-Zero goals, there are significant challenges to delivering on these ambitions. Business leaders don’t really know how they will get there. And the very first step, of getting emissions measurement right, is hard.

Terrascope is an enterprise-grade, end-to-end decarbonisation SaaS platform. By combining AI-assisted carbon measurement & management with deep industry & sustainability expertise, Terrascope helps solve the data management, emissions reduction planning and implementation challenges that large enterprises face to decarbonise their operations and complex supply chains.

Publicly launched in June '22, Terrascope is working with customers in multiple industry verticals such as agriculture, food & beverage and consumer packaged goods, as well as horizontals such as manufacturing, technology, transportation and real estate. Terrascope is an innovative player to support enterprises in their green transformation.

Backed by Nupo Ventures (formerly Olam Ventures) and incubated with support from BCG X, Terrascope has now achieved a number of globally recognised accreditations, with more on the way – including being the first CDP Gold Accredited Software provider from Asia and signing The Climate Pledge to be net zero by 2040. Terrascope aims to lead by example and demonstrate that business growth and carbon reduction can go hand in hand.

We are looking for a Carbon Data Analyst to join the team. You will play the crucial role of supporting our customers on their carbon measurement and emission reduction journey, using the Terrascope platform alongside our professional services offering. Measurements are performed in accordance with international carbon accounting standards, namely the Greenhouse Gas Protocol Corporate and Product Standards. Using your learnings, you will provide feedback to the product development team to continuously improve the user experience of measuring greenhouse gas emissions, communicating insights, and advising on emissions reduction strategies. This role reports into the Head of Sustainability.

In this role you will:
• Collaborate with our Customer Success Managers and interface with the client to define the data required to complete a customer’s carbon footprint measurement
• Work with customers to help them provide the correct data required for calculating their greenhouse gas emission inventory across Scopes 1, 2 and 3 for corporate emissions, and full life cycle for product emissions. Provide guidance on what additional data is required to enrich raw data sets for footprint measurement.
• Transform unstructured data sets provided by clients into structured data which can be ingested into our product’s data processing pipeline to calculate carbon emissions.
• Use our platform to calculate, map, and publish carbon footprints that will be used by a company for their climate strategies, actions, and reports.
• Support companies to understand their sources of greenhouse gas emissions, set emissions reduction targets, and identify the most impactful decarbonisation opportunities.
• Document carbon accounting methodologies and advise customers on opportunities to improve their data year-on-year.
• Provide feedback and learnings to our product development team to improve workflows and extend the platform's capabilities.

You should be/have:
• 2+ years of experience in a data analytics, solutions engineering or consulting role, with a desire to pivot into a career at the intersection of technology, data and sustainability.
• Customer focused: A strong ownership of your work, and are excited to work in a client facing role. A strong verbal and written communicator who can simplify and communicate complex concepts to a novice audience.
• Product orientation: Be an early software adopter, rapidly testing out new product features, and be excited to contribute to building an ever better product.
• Data processing: Skills in writing SQL queries, data engineering and structuring skills, or have a quantitative background with a desire to learn. Proficiency in Python.
• You are efficient, systematic and attentive to details, understanding how numbers from an excel sheet translate to real world business transactions and operations.
• Excited to be part of a company that is empowering multinational enterprises to reduce greenhouse gas emissions across their direct operations and upstream and downstream value chains.

Nice to have, and willing to learn:
• Climate or sustainability-related industry and knowledge on GreenHouse Gas Accounting Principles.
• Exposure to sectors such as CPG, food and agriculture, or transportation.

We're committed to creating an inclusive environment for our strong and diverse team. We value diversity and foster a community where everyone can be his or her authentic self.

Location: London

Canada Life UK looks after the retirement, investment and protection needs of individuals, families and companies. We help to build better futures for our customers, our intermediaries and our employees by operating as a modern, agile and welcoming organisation.

Part of our parent company Great-West Lifeco, Canada Life UK has operated in the United Kingdom since 1903. We have hundreds of respected and supported employees committed to doing the right thing for our customers and colleagues.

Canada Life UK is transforming to create a more customer-focused business by providing our customers with expertise on financial and tax planning, offering home finance and annuities propositions, and providing collective fund solutions to third party customers.

Job Summary:

Working in the UK Reward team you will be collaborating with key stakeholders to model, analyse and provide insight on compensation data for the reward team and for the business. The role will also involve compensation system development and process improvement across reward processes and practices. This will include accurate production, analysis and submission of data to providers and modelling of pay gap data and ensuring we adhere to our reporting requirements and support our diversity, equity and inclusion agenda. The role will play a key role in supporting system enhancements and annual configuration changes for our annual review system on SuccessFactors.

You will be responsible for ensuring system data integrity and taking necessary steps to maintain data to support wider reporting across the business, managing effective People reporting. This role will be integral to process improvement and automation and will be done via collaboration across the UK and European reward teams and wider People Strategy function.

Responsibilities:

1. Responsible for data analysis and modelling of compensation and PS data, using medium to large data sets. Reporting and data analysed will provide insight for the reward and compensation team and across PS. This will include analysing executive level compensation data as well as using market data from survey providers to model total compensation packages and provide data and insight to the Head of Reward and Compensation Manager on the competitiveness of our reward proposition

Models built and data analysed should be auditable and user-friendly and the role holder will be able to use their data analytics skills to support other team members and improve and automate existing data analysis and reporting.

Data modelling and analysis will be used in pay gap reporting and equal pay audits, as well as providing insights to the People Strategy Reward team.

2. Lead on maintenance and continuous improvement of the Compensation and Variable pay module as part of the year-end salary and bonus review, including involvement in lessons-learned and process improvement activity that will ensure system integrity and ease of use for end-users.

Ensure CVP is tested and fully set up for end-to-end cycle in Q1 each year. Completion of all analytical requirements for the annual review cycle which is managed on Success Factors and carry out UAT, regression and any SAP testing related to CVP updates and releases. . Assist with the data cleansing exercises in preparation for the year-end cycle.

This activity will include ensuring that planning for system changes and enhancements is clear, documented and with well-understood lead times that the Reward and wider PS Systems and operations teams are informed of and involved with.

Maintain the stakeholder relationship with Rizing. Work with them to find ways to make the annual review process simpler and also maximise automation where possible. Reduce dependency on Rizing by developing, documenting and maintaining all current and new CVP related workflows.

Raising of JIRAs and tickets on SuccessFactors related to system updates, queries and improvements. Responsible for logging, tracking and providing updates on these processes.

3. Extracting data from compensation and share plan systems to resolve queries and use in data modelling and salary survey submissions. Supporting and analysing data associated with remuneration disclosures and responsible for responding to data and information requests from external bodies and internal teams. This could be information related to employee share schemes, annual data submission to market data providers and for Pay Gap reporting.

4. Supporting governance processes related to DPIAs and reward process documentation and roadmaps to ensure we have documented, clear and robust processes.

5. To assist the wider PS systems Team in the improvement and automation of processes within the People Systems IS software by participating in sustainment releases. Managing tickets from creation to implementation. Regular review of open system tickets to ensure sustainment deadlines are met. Keep all CVP relating documentation up to date, i.e. user guides.

6. Provide day to day support to colleagues in the Reward and wider PS team as required, including

monitoring of the collective reward inbox to triage and address reward queries in a timely and efficient

manager. Assist with various administrative tasks, as well as any ad-hoc Reward projects as required

across the broader business.

Experience Required:

• Experience working in a HR systems or HR reward role as a subject matter expert within a centre of excellence HR model is essential

• Very strong analytical, data modelling and numerical skills

• Advanced user of Microsoft Office, especially Excel. Experience using vlookups, xlookups, Pivot tables, Index Matching, IF/SUM formulae with multiple data sets

• Ability to manage and interpret large sets of data and ideally demonstrable understanding of Power BI.

• Previous experience using SAP Success Factors (specifically CVP) with a strong understanding of the system and process improvements

• Experience with JIRA and Confluence or other HRIS ticketing systems

• Detailed approach to managing data. Understanding that you will be handling sensitive information about the company and its partners and employees, therefore exercising discretion and confidentiality at all times.

• Able to provide a positive partnering approach with colleagues and stakeholders

• Ability to work within a virtual team with colleagues and stakeholders spread across multiple locations

• Strong delivery and customer focus

• Proactive and self-reliant

• Demonstrates sound judgment in knowing when to escalate issues or seek support from colleagues

• Communicates clearly and effectively across all levels of management

• Strong knowledge of the financial services regulatory environment

• Delivery focussed approach on delivering the best possible results showing attention to detail and resourcefulness.

• Demonstrates a high level of personal organisation. Able to manage multiple tasks effectively at any one time

• Works in an organised and systematic manner to ensure quality outputs are delivered and timelines are met

Qualifications

• Ideally the job holder will be working towards the SAP SF accreditation, but this is not mandatory.

Benefits of working at Canada Life

We believe in recognising and rewarding our people, so we offer a competitive salary and benefits package that’s regularly reviewed. As a Canada Life UK colleague, you’ll receive a competitive salary and comprehensive reward package including a generous pension and bonus scheme, along with, income protection, private medical insurance and life assurance. We have a fantastic number of other benefits and support services as well as regular personal and professional development.

How we work at Canada Life

Our culture is unique and incredibly important to us. We care about doing the right thing for our people, customers and community and helping others to build better futures. Our blueprint behaviours shape and influence how we work, and are central to the relationships we have with others. Every day we are encouraged to be more curious, own the outcome, face into things together and find a way forward.

We want colleagues to have rewarding careers with us so we invest in the development of our people, technology and workplaces. That’s why we offer a range of training, flexible working and opportunities to grow and develop.

Diversity and inclusion

Building an inclusive workplace with a diverse workforce where everyone can feel they belong and achieve their potential regardless of gender, ethnicity or any other characteristic is a key commitment for us. We are proud of the progress we’re making in DEI, and we continue for it to be a significant focus.

“At Canada Life we believe in the power of great people from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives coming together to build better futures. Emerging talent is crucial to our growth and creating an environment that continues to inspire us all.” Nick Harding, Chief People Officer, Canada Life UK

We appreciate that everyone has different work and life responsibilities. We’re happy to discuss flexible working arrangements, including part time, for any of our roles should this be a requirement for you.

Master Data Analyst - req1390

OVERVIEW

Responsible for performing data quality checks, evaluating inconsistencies in the master data, and recommending effective solutions to increase data integrity. This role will also coordinate the implementation of strategic projects and work with team members across all departments. This role will develop and maintain key performance indicators for master data.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Research all requests and inquiries for changes in the master data; exercise prudent judgement and logical thinking to prevent issues with operations, reporting, and database quality of the organization.

Job Number: R0213432

Data Analyst

The Opportunity:

As a Data Analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support a mission and use data for good.

As a client-facing data analyst on our team, you'll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you provide a deep understanding of their data, but you'll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to impact missions.

How You'll Contribute:

As a data analyst on our team, you'll:
• Use your data analytics expertise to support client and stakeholder relationships.
• Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through the collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets.
• Contribute to impactful work and guide decision-making across multiple organizations.
• Apply consulting and your communication skills and data analytics expertise by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
• Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages
• Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
• Apply data visualization through different formats such as executive dashboards so decision-makers can make data-driven decisions
• Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions across the mission

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:
• 5+ years of experience with data visualization techniques and tools, including Power BI Tableau or Microsoft Fabric, and Spark or PySpark for data analysis
• Experience with structured data to solve tangible intelligence problems using tools, including SQL, R, or Python programming languages, data visualization software, and statistical analysis
• Experience analyzing data sets to spot trends and patterns that can be translated into actionable insights
• Experience in statistics and with statistical software, including Excel
• Experience in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data
• Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and how to apply them to large datasets
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
• Secret clearance
• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Technology, Science, or Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Data Science

Nice If You Have:
• Experience analyzing Microsoft 365 and Moveworks data
• Experience with agile methodologies
• Experience working in dynamic, ambiguous environments that require flexibility
• Experience as a cyber analyst
• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and tools
• Ability to communicate technical information and recommendations to peers, engineers, and analytic customers using strong verbal and written communication
• Top Secret clearance
• Master's degree in Technology, Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or Data Science
• Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) Certification

Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Company Overview
Zeus Fire & Security was formed as a platform business to partner with and scale leading fire and security operators in premier markets. Since 2021 we've challenged the status quo of the security industry by leveraging our network to help well-established companies become more pronounced in the territories in which they sit. Currently, we have 7 main hubs that sit on the east coast, in the Midwest, and across Hawaii, providing resources, technology and industry leadership. Through the support provided by Zeus, our hub companies can charter new waters, expand their markets, and dive into new sectors of business and technology. Our greatest strength (or Z-Factor, as we call it) is our people – ignite your career with Zeus and help us make a difference in the safety and security of communities across the nation.

Role Overview
The Company is seeking a highly skilled and detailed oriented senior data analyst to join the Finance team with a specific focus on analyzing operational and financial data to support the data migration of an ERP implementation project and developing ongoing business reporting requirements. This individual will play a critical role in supporting the development of reporting from operational and financial data available from legacy systems and newly implemented ERP systems. This function will lead to critical data consolidation and reporting efforts and drive future state reporting, including operational and financial KPIs, in the new ERP system, Oracle NetSuite.

The role requires the ability to lead a project, work effectively under tight deadlines, pay extreme attention to detail, and perform consistently accurate, high-quality financial and operational analyses. This individual will assist in developing strategies, policies and governance models to ensure the Company's data remains accurate, timely and relevant to the reporting goals. Working closely with IT and data analysis is essential for this role. Expectations for managing the completion of visually appealing and interactive dashboards to communicate financial and operational information effectively is a key output.

Key Responsibilities
• Ability to understand financial and operational metrics and reporting
• Works closely with stakeholders and data architects to define and design data solutions to support data and reporting initiatives
• Supports ERP data migration and implementation project including data normalization and mapping efforts from legacy to new systems
• Creates mock-up solution designs, visualizations and reports to effectively demonstrate proposed solutions and deliverables
• Ability to develop and execute a data driven project plan
• Acts a subject matter expert on Company's data platforms and educates team members on best practices as they relate to usage
• Ensure master data management principles are followed through course of day-to-day usage and solution design
• Other ad-hoc financial analyses include building financial models, customer analysis, job performance, sales performance, operating expenses, and other areas as required.
• Works collaboratively with the CFO, CIO, VP of Finance, Controller and Information Technology teams.
• Acts as a liaison between Finance, ERP Implementation Teams and IT
• Prepares and maintains process documentation, process control narratives, and training materials for new employees.
• Maintain company confidentiality at all times.
• Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, data analytics computer science, or related field
• 5+ years of experience in a similar role
• Demonstrates understanding of financial and operational metrics
• Demonstrates Demonstrable experience with data migrations and handling sensitive financial data.
• Understanding of data governance principles and practices.
• High proficiency in MS Excel (e.g., formulas, pivot tables, tables, and graph production) and MS PowerPoint
• Experience with Oracle NetSuite preferred
• Proficiency in creating and managing PowerBI reports.
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software
• Strong analytical skills
• Must be able to multitask and meet deadlines
• Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Principal Data Analyst-EPX

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Analyst at Capital One you will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.

On any given day you will be challenged on three types of work – Innovation, Business Intelligence and Data Management:

Innovation
• Use Open Source/Digital technologies to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data sources and platforms
• Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers
• Demonstrate ability to explore and quickly grasp new technologies to progress varied initiatives

Business Intelligence
• Partner with the business to provide consultancy and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
• Drive analysis that provides meaningful insights on business strategies

Data Management
• Drive an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions
• Work collaboratively with appropriate Tech teams to manage security mechanisms and data access governance
• Build and execute tools to monitor and report on data quality

Our ideal candidate will have:
• Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• Scripting experience in (Python, R, Spark, and SQL)
• Strong desire and experience with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data)
• Experience utilizing and developing within AWS services

Basic Qualifications
• Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related quantitative field) plus at least 5 years of experience performing data analytics, or currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Master’s Degree plus at least 3 years performing data analytics with an expectation that required degree will be obtained on or before the scheduled start date.
• At least 3 years of experience working with at least one scripting language
• At least 3 years of experience utilizing a business intelligence visualization tool
• At least 3 years of experience in querying, analyzing and working with data languages and platforms

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline
• At least 4 years of experience coding in Python, R, Spark, or SQL
• At least 4 years of experience working within process management and improvement methodologies – Agile, Lean, Six Sigma, etc.
• At least 2 years of experience utilizing and developing within AWS services
• At least 2 years of experience delivering Data Governance and Data Quality Management concepts and practices within the financial services industry

Company: General Court of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts
Job Description:
Agency Overview:

The Department of Revenue's core mission is to collect the revenues required to support the business of the Commonwealth, to make a difference in the lives of children by enforcing the financial responsibilities of parenthood, and to assist Massachusetts cities and towns in sound and efficient fiscal management. Our vision is to conduct our operations in a manner that inspires public confidence in government by administering and enforcing tax, child support and municipal finance laws in ways that are innovative, customer-focused and transparent.

Division Overview:

The Division of Local Services helps Massachusetts cities and towns achieve sound and efficient fiscal management through technical assistance, training and oversight. Its bureaus are responsible for ensuring the fairness and equity of local property taxation, the accuracy and quality of local accounting and treasury management, interpreting state laws that affect local governance, distributing local aid, and maintaining a comprehensive databank on local finances.

About the Role

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Support and Business Analyst to join our team, specializing in providing exceptional support for our internal software applications while contributing to process improvements and analytical insights. The ideal candidate will prioritize user support and troubleshooting while leveraging business analysis to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities

User Support and Troubleshooting (Primary Focus):
• This is a constituent-focused role, which involves logging calls and ensuring they progress to completion while keeping clients consistently updated.
• Serve as the first point of contact for support requests, ensuring timely resolution of help desk tickets.
• Develop and maintain technical documentation, support guides, and training materials to empower end-users.
• Exhibit excellent written and verbal communication skills. Convey complex product details effortlessly to diverse audiences, fostering clarity and understanding.
• Manage an internal system to ensure effective user maintenance and support evolving organizational requirements.
• You are going to be successful in this position if you are excited to help both external and internal customers being patient, empathetic and passionately communicative to all

System Enhancements and Optimization (Secondary Focus):
• Act as a liaison between internal users and the IT team, effectively communicating user needs and technical limitations.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather and document requirements for system updates or new features.
• Analyze user feedback and system performance metrics to identify areas for improvement.
• Participate in the design, testing, and implementation of software updates and new features.

Process Improvement and Reporting:
• Support the analysis of business processes to identify opportunities for streamlining workflows and reducing manual tasks.
• Provide ad hoc reporting and data insights to stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making.

Collaboration and Innovation:
• Act as a bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and alignment on goals.
• Stay informed about emerging tools and technologies to suggest enhancements for support and system efficiency.
• A key part of the role will be to proactively continue personal development and be driven to consistently deliver value outcomes for DARB.

An external candidate recommended for a position with the Department of Revenue will be subject to a background check that includes checks for: state and federal tax compliance; child support compliance; education verification; Massachusetts CORI checks; criminal background checks in state(s) of current and previous residence/employment; validation of eligibility to work in the United States; and national fingerprint-based criminal background checks.

As part of the Future of Work initiative, the agency has adopted a hybrid work model.Hybrid work is a mix of in-office work and telework. This position will work remotely some days and in-person on other days.

First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

Minimum Entrance Requirements:

Applicants must have (A) at least two years of full-time or equivalent part-time professional or technical experience performing related duties that include business data recovery, analysis, query design, reporting and statistical analysis; or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below

Substitutions:

I. A Bachelor’s degree or higher with a major in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related field may be substituted for the required experience

Comprehensive Benefits

When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future.

Want the specifics? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!

Job description

A glimpse at the job:

POWERED BY TRUST. At Safran Electrical & Power, we're all about trust: the trust employees place in the Safran Group and the trust customers place in us. We trust our employees to bring bold ideas to build the future of aerospace together, contributing to our ranking by TIME as the top Aerospace & Defense company on the 2023 World's Best Companies list (#59 on the full list).

We're looking for a Data Analyst who thrives on data-driven insights and enjoys tackling challenges to improve operational efficiency, decision making and growth. In this role, you'll play a key part in our Data management project by developing impactful, SQL-based reports for Power BI dashboards and analyzing data across finance, programs, supply chain, and manufacturing. As a crucial member of our team, you'll collaborate closely with diverse departments, ensuring a seamless Data and ERP management while delivering actionable insights that drive our business forward. If you're detail-oriented, analytical, and eager to make a tangible impact, we'd love to have you join us!

Complementary description

Key Responsibilities:
• Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets related to finance, supply chain, manufacturing, and program management.
• SQL Reporting: Develop and maintain SQL-based reports to support operational decision-making and performance tracking.
• ERP Migration Support: Collaborate with the ERP implementation team and the M3 Systems Analysts to define data requirements, validate data integrity, and ensure accurate data migration.
• Reporting and Dashboards: Create interactive dashboards and visualizations in Power BI to present data insights clearly and effectively.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with finance, supply chain, and manufacturing teams to identify data needs, develop KPIs, and support process improvements.
• Data Quality Assurance: Monitor data quality and integrity, identifying discrepancies and implementing corrective actions as needed.
• Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of data sources, methodologies, and analytical processes for future reference and training purposes.
• Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders at all levels, translating complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.

Job requirements

Safran Electrical & Power looks for service-oriented team players with strong interpersonal skills, the right attitude and adaptability to an innovative and evolving environment.

Education and/or Experience
• Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
• 3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably within finance, supply chain, or manufacturing contexts.
• Proficiency in SQL and experience creating reports in Power BI.
• Familiarity with ERP systems and migration processes is a plus.
• Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:
• Experience in project management methodologies.
• Knowledge of financial metrics and supply chain KPIs.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Candidates for positions with Safran Electrical & Power must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Employment eligibility verification will be required at the time of hire.

Specificity of the job

Occasional travels in North America (US/ MX) and Europe.

Safran is an international high-technology group, operating in the aviation (propulsion, equipment and interiors), defense and space markets. Its core purpose is to contribute to a safer, more sustainable world, where air transport is more environmentally friendly, comfortable and accessible. Safran has a global presence, with 92,000 employees and sales of 23.2 billion euros in 2023, and holds, alone or in partnership, world or regional leadership positions in its core markets. Safran undertakes research and development programs to maintain the environmental priorities of its R&T and innovation roadmap.
Safran is in the 1st place in the aerospace and defense industry in TIME magazine's "World's best companies 2023" ranking.

Safran Electrical & Power is one of the world's leaders in aircraft electrical systems. It is a key player in the equipment electrification & in the electric and hybrid propulsion sector. Mastering the on-board energy system, the company designs and provides modular, innovative and optimized architectures and solutions.

Bachelor's Degree
More than 3 years

Overview

This is a remote role that may be hired in several markets across the United States.

The Governance Data Analyst will manage organization-wide data management and governance activities and improve the data management components, including Data Standards, Quality, Metadata, Governance, Mater Data, and protecting sensitive data and information assets. You will focus on establishing and ensuring adherence to an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards, and practices at the department and Business and Functional areas level to achieve consistency, quality, and protection to meet overall business needs.

With a critical focus on building Data Management Capability across all data assets, the Enterprise Data Governance team aims to establish data as a strategic asset with the right standards of care applied by enabling foundational capabilities, achieving higher data maturity, and delivering business value.

Responsibilities
• Managing, configuring, and monitoring the internal instances of the One Data Catalog platform directly.
• Experience capturing and analyzing requirements (internal and external) and translating them into a viable product.
• Creating data governance operating models, including assets, relationships, domains, and communities, keeping efficiency, understandability, and usability atop.
• Hands-on building and maintaining the DGC Operating model, Data Catalogue, Workflows, Reference data, And data integration with source systems.
• Establish data standards and build foundational components such as Data policy, Enterprise glossary, and data ownership.
• Map end-to-end Enterprise Data Supply Chain (data lineage), partnering with IT and Data governance operation functions.
• Provide Enterprise data governance platform and tools to operationalize data governance.
• Leverage Collibra API to meet the integration needs with the Collibra DGC platform.
• Validation support of Metadata import and export jobs and creation of Data Governance reporting/KPIs.
• Responsible for adherence to SDLC policies and standards for technical management of the Collibra DGC platform
• Maintain a solid understanding of Collibra DGC capabilities and the product's roadmap to ensure the adequate technical design of solutions in the platform.
• Supporting ad-hoc questions from the Product, Design, and Engineering leadership team for data requests and visualization
• Promoting a data-driven culture in Product, Design, and Engineering (Enable your stakeholders to leverage your work and build their insights
• Being the critical stakeholder for Product, Design, and Engineering to the Data Office team to build and maintain an entirely self-service model where every team can add queries to get insights into product usage or content from our cloud customer base.
• Validate completeness of data lineage between the point of data element creation (system of record) and the point where it is consumed by business users (trusted data sources) and design processes for implementation to certify Tier 1 KDEs and Reports
• Demonstrated ability to understand business processes and pain points to lead the definition of data requirements to meet complex business needs and drive data quality.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree and 4 years of experience in Data Management, Financial Analysis, or similar.

OR

High School Diploma or GED and 8 years of experience in Data Management, Financial Analysis, or similar.

Preferred Qualifications
• 5 years of experience in one or more of the following areas: BCBS 239 implementation, DMBOK, DCAM, data domain and stewardship, business process and data architecture, data sourcing certification, reference or master data management, data and metadata management, business intelligence or data product ownership
• Experience with SQL and relational databases, query authoring, and working familiarity with various databases.
• Some programming experience with object-oriented languages like Python and Java.
• Experience with software development life cycle processes and tools in a data analysis context (Jira, Confluence, )
• Strong relationship-building skills with the ability to effectively interact with various individuals.
• Able to lead meetings and discussions through very strong verbal communication skills.
• Experience working with agile development teams on scalable, cloud-based SaaS solutions.
• Knowledge of the leading PaaS providers, Data Lakes, Databases, and Integration platforms (SQL, Databricks, GCP, Snowflake etc.)

America’s Test Kitchen (ATK) is seeking a Data Analyst, Subscriber Growth to join our team. This role will focus on driving data accuracy and insights for subscription performance through robust attribution modeling and analysis. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of subscription metrics, digital attribution, and cross-channel performance, paired with strong analytical skills to optimize marketing efforts.

Responsibilities
• Attribution Modeling & Analysis: Develop and maintain accurate attribution models to assess the effectiveness of various acquisition channels (e.g., paid media, organic, partnerships).
• Subscription Performance Metrics: Monitor and report on key metrics across web and mobile app, including LTV, CAC, ROAS, churn, and retention to provide actionable insights.
• Cross-Channel Testing: Analyze acquisition channel performance and work with team to optimize spend allocation across paid media.
• Data Visualization & Reporting: Create clear, actionable dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar platforms.
• Collaboration with Stakeholders: Work closely with marketing, finance, and product teams to ensure alignment on attribution strategies and subscription growth initiatives.
• Lifecycle Insights: Partner with the lifecycle marketing team to assess email, push, and retention campaigns, identifying areas for optimization and growth.

Skills You’ll Need
• Advanced skills in data analysis tools like SQL and familiarity with attribution and analytics platforms such as Google Analytics.
• Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau or Mixpanel to create actionable reports and dashboards.
• Strong grasp of attribution methodologies, including first-touch, last-click, and multi-touch models, and the ability to interpret complex datasets.
• Knowledge of subscription-based metrics such as LTV, CAC, ROAS, churn, and retention, with experience optimizing acquisition and lifecycle marketing outcomes.
• Familiarity with A/B and multivariate testing for campaign performance and optimization strategies.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and present insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Qualifications & Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.
• 2–4 years of experience in digital marketing analytics for subscription-based business models or recurring revenue environments.
• Expertise in attribution methodologies (e.g., last-click, multi-touch, incrementality testing).
• Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) and data manipulation (e.g., SQL, Acxiom).
• Strong experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
• Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
• Familiarity with MarTech platforms such as CDPs, CEPs, and MMPs.
• Knowledge of A/B and multivariate testing.

This position is located in our Boston, MA office in the Seaport district. It is the expectation that the person in this role will work a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week (Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday) in the office and 2 days per week remotely.

About America’s Test Kitchen

The mission of America’s Test Kitchen (ATK) is to empower and inspire confidence, community, and creativity in the kitchen. Founded in 1992, the company is the leading multimedia cooking resource serving millions of fans with TV shows (America’s Test Kitchen, Cook's Country, and America’s Test Kitchen: The Next Generation), magazines (Cook’s Illustrated and Cook’s Country), cookbooks, a podcast (Proof), FAST channels, short-form video series, and the ATK Essential Membership for digital content. Based in a state-of-the-art 15,000-square-foot test kitchen in Boston’s Seaport District, ATK has earned the trust of home cooks and culinary experts alike thanks to its one-of-a-kind processes and best-in-class techniques. Fifty full-time (admittedly very meticulous) test cooks, editors, and product testers spend their days tweaking every variable to find the very best recipes, equipment, ingredients, and techniques. Learn more at https://www.americastestkitchen.com/.

Why America’s Test Kitchen:

We're passionate about cooking, and about creating the best place to work. We're small enough for your ideas to make a big impact, and large enough to offer you opportunities to grow professionally at any stage of your career. We want you to take risks and make mistakes — that's how innovation happens in our test kitchen, in our offices, and in life.

We at America’s Test Kitchen believe food media can be a powerful force for social change. We are passionate about building an inclusive workforce that represents many different cultures, backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives.

We welcome your application.

A company is looking for a Data Analyst III responsible for handling complex data projects and leading other Data Analysts.Key ResponsibilitiesProvide advanced analytical support for business operations in various data areasExtract, load, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platformsDevelop reports and deliverables for management while ensuring compliance with reporting requirementsRequired QualificationsBachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience4+ years of statistical analysis or 2+ years of related IT experience, including data warehouse, coding, or ETL experienceHealthcare experience preferredExperience managing projects or heavy involvement in project implementationExperience with Teradata, Snowflake, SSIS, Power Automate, and Power BI is strongly preferred

RaceTrac Company Overview

Job Description:

The Analytics Consultant is a key member of the Enterprise Strategic Analytics + Data Science team (ESADS), serving as a bridge between strategic business needs and analytical solutions. This role partners with business units and Analytics Partners to identify and address analytical opportunities, leveraging both consulting and technical skills to design and deliver data-driven insights that drive business growth and operational excellence. The Consultant is expected to demonstrate a proactive and solution-oriented approach, translating business challenges into actionable analytical projects and contributing to the development of a data-driven culture within the organization.

Responsibilities:
• Analytical Project Execution:
• Lead and execute analytical projects, applying appropriate methodologies and techniques, under the guidance of Analytics Partners.
• Conduct data exploration, cleaning, and preparation to ensure data quality and integrity.
• Develop and implement analytical models, leveraging statistical and machine learning techniques as needed.
• Generate actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
• Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences through clear visualizations and presentations.
• Actively participate in the implementation and deployment of analytical solutions.
• Strategic Partnership:
• Collaborate with business stakeholders and Analytics Partners to understand their goals, challenges, and analytical requirements.
• Proactively identify opportunities to leverage analytics to drive business value and improve decision-making.
• Translate business needs into well-defined analytical projects, outlining scope, objectives, and success metrics.
• Conduct comprehensive business assessments and needs analyses to inform project prioritization and execution.
• Support Analytics Partners in developing strategic recommendations and roadmaps.
• Technical Expertise:
• Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
• Utilize data visualization tools to create clear and impactful presentations.
• Stay abreast of emerging analytical techniques and technologies.
• Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to data and analysis.
• Contribute to the development and maintenance of data pipelines and analytical infrastructure.
• Collaboration and Mentorship:
• Work closely with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and other team members to deliver comprehensive solutions.
• Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts, fostering their development and growth.
• Contribute to a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment within the team.
• Foster cross-functional collaboration and alignment to ensure successful project outcomes.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Business, Economics, Finance, Math, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
• Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in consulting, analytics, data science, or a related field, with demonstrated success in delivering analytical projects required.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business problems into analytical frameworks.
• Proven experience performing business analysis or financial/statistical data analysis, preferably in a retail environment.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and knowledge of Business Intelligence Tools such as Microsoft Power BI.
• Advanced knowledge of SQL, SAS, SPSS, Palantir, Python, and other relevant analytical software.
• Knowledge of syndicated data like IRI and Nielsen is a plus.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with RaceTrac without regard to their race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.

**Job Description**
• *Job Summary**

Designs and implements processes and solutions associated with a wide variety of data sets used for data/text mining, analysis, modeling, and predicting (Power BI and Databricks) to enable informed business decisions. Gains insight into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine structured and unstructured data from multiple disparate sources. Collaborates across departments and with customers to define requirements and understand business problems. Uses advanced mathematical, statistical, querying, and reporting methods to develop solutions. Develops information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries to monitor and improve business performance. Creates solutions from initial concept to fully tested production and communicates results to a broad range of audiences. Effectively uses current and emerging technologies.
• *Job Functions**

• Leverage analytics and quantitative methods (using Power BI and Databricks) to inform and influence decision making for the Medicare Stars program

• Responsible for data compilation, data management, data analysis, and reporting

• Influence and build relationships with people across all levels of the organization, internally and externally

• Extracts and compiles various sources of information and large data sets from various systems or applications

• Sets up process for monitoring, tracking and trending information and data using various systems or applications

• Prepares well-organized, easily understood reports, analysis, and summary of findings for use by management

• Researches and analyzes report results identifying opportunities and trends

• Works with internal, external and enterprise individuals as needed to research, develop and document new standard reports or processes

• Consolidates data from multiple sources, using industry-based tools or manually; able to process data effectively using Microsoft Excel

• Supports management and other team members as requested on all things data related

Insight Global is hiring for a Data Analyst to sit 100% onsite for a large, telecommunication company. This data analyst is joining the Location Lifecycle Management team within Customer Operations. This team is responsible for managing part of the RDOF or Rural Digital Opportunity Fund initiative. This is an estimated 6-year initiative to expand their footprint or services in rural areas. This initiative is estimated to activate or add 1.1 million customers to the company. This data analyst will be responsible for working with various groups and stakeholders, extracting their data from multiple sources, identifying any gaps or discrepancies, then being able to report their findings. This data will be pertaining to which customers services have been activated or still need to be done. On a day-to-day basis, this data analyst will spend 50% of their time within data analysis: extracting data from the various data sources and creating reports on it within Excel or Tableau and the other 50% meeting with stakeholders to understand their data and able to ensure all their data is centralized so all groups can access it.

Job Title: Data Analyst Job at HM Electronics Inc in Carlsbad
Job Description:
HME has been creating innovative products for the drive-thru and pro-audio industries since 1971. From the very beginning, we've known these solutions would never have happened without the customer-focused people who make up our company. HME has a team environment with a culture of collaboration, learning, and growth. With subsidiaries located in California, Georgia, Missouri, Canada, UK, and China, companies around the world depend on HME for clear, reliable communication solutions.We are actively seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join the HME team. This important position will be responsible for analyzing complex quality data and delivering actionable insights to improve business outcomes and increase customer satisfaction. Job Title: Mid to Senior-Level Data Analyst​/Data Engineer
Job Description:
Location: Snowflake

Job Title:
Mid to Senior-Level Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Location:
Remote

Position Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled Mid to Senior-Level Data Analyst/Data Engineer with expertise in Azure Databricks, Power BI, and advanced SQL. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data modeling, ETL development, and managing end-to-end data processes. This role also involves working with Azure Data Factory (ADF), ADO and advanced capabilities in Databricks and Power BI.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement robust data models using facts, dimensions, Snowflake, and Star Schema principles to support analytics and reporting.
• Design, build, and optimize ETL processes to integrate diverse applications into Azure Data Lake.
• Create and manage scalable data pipelines in Azure Data Factory (ADF) while leveraging Azure Dev Ops (ADO) for workflow orchestration and automation.
• Utilize Databricks to implement and manage Lakehouse architecture, optimize computes, and configure workflows and triggers for efficient data processing.
• Build interactive and insightful Power BI dashboards and reports using custom templates, calculated columns, DAX, and advanced SQL, while managing direct query and import modes for optimal performance.
• Leverage SQL for advanced querying, including the use of Windows functions and Common Table Expressions (CTEs), to analyze and transform data effectively.
• Write and maintain Python and PySpark code for data transformation and pipeline enhancement.
• Troubleshoot data pipelines and workflows to ensure high reliability, accuracy, and performance of data operations.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions and deliver actionable insights.
• Present complex data findings effectively through storytelling, visualization, and clear communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, or related discipline).
• 4-5 years of experience in data analysis, engineering, and visualization.
• Proficient in SQL (including advanced functions like Windows functions and CTEs) and No

SQL databases.
• Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud services, including Azure Databricks, ADF, and ADO.
• Expertise in Power BI, including DAX, custom templates, calculated columns, and direct/import modes.
• Advanced skills in Python programming and PySpark.
• In-depth knowledge of data modeling techniques (Snowflake, Star Schema).
• Strong problem-solving abilities and communication skills.
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively on complex projects.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with Health care is a plus.
• Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics is a plus.

Job Title: Data Analyst II, Enterprise Data Management - Business Intelligence & Analytics | New York, NY, USA
Job Description:
Data Analyst II, Enterprise Data Management - Business Intelligence & Analytics

The Enterprise Data Management (EDM) organization is comprised of multiple teams that are responsible for developing, executing, and delivering data products across a new cloud platform at Neuberger Berman. The Business Intelligence & Reporting team within EDM is responsible for delivering reporting and analytics solutions that enable our stakeholders to make data-driven decisions. We are an extension of the EDM team and work closely with front office groups and the technology teams that support them. This role is an opportunity to be part of the team driving our EDM and Business Intelligence reporting strategy at Neuberger Berman.

Responsibilities:

• Play a key role in scaling the firm's Business Intelligence & Analytics capabilities and BI data assets.
• Support the EDM team's cloud strategy, including self-service analytics and data-as-a-service.
• Develop scalable analytics solutions that promote and support the EDM team's cloud and data governance strategies.
• Conduct data analysis across different source systems and become proficient across multiple data domains.
• Identify opportunities to incorporate the firm's internal Generative AI platform with Business Intelligence capabilities.
• Manage the team's Change Management and development of CI/CD for Tableau.
• Work closely with QA teams to ensure appropriate testing and sign-offs are handled prior to production releases.
• Support the Business Intelligence Center of Enablement initiatives and operating model within Global Technology.
Qualifications:

• 4+ years of data analytics in the field of Business Intelligence or Information Management. Financial service experience a plus.
• Excellent attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and ability to prioritize work within a dynamic, deadline-driven environment.
• Prior experience with Business Intelligence technologies including Tableau, PowerBI, SAP Business Objects, or Crystal. Tableau and Tableau Cloud are a big plus.
• Advanced knowledge of Snowflake or SQL and relational and dimensional database structures and practices.
• Experience with programming in Python.
• Familiarity with enterprise technology tools: Tidal Enterprise Scheduler, Service Now, JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps, Azure GIT, or Airflow.
• Experience developing data models in Snowflake that are used for scalable Business Intelligence dashboards and include user entitlements a big plus.
• Experience with implementing data fabric, a centralized approach to automate and integrate data access a plus.
• Experience using enterprise data catalog tools like Collibra with Business Intelligence tools like Tableau a big plus.
• Experience driving best practices as a member of Business Intelligence Center of Enablement a plus.
• Team player with a strong work ethic, positive attitude, and motivated by continuous learning and taking ownership in your work.
