Job Title: Analyst 3, Data Analytics - Power BI Developer 6+ Years Experience
Job Description:
Company Description

At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.

At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.

We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.

Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.

We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™ and WD® brands.

Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Senior Power BI Developer with 6+ years of expertise in designing and developing enterprise-level BI solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating insightful dashboards and reports, translating business requirements into technical solutions, and supporting data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations using best practices.
• Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and understand reporting requirements.
• Create and maintain efficient and scalable data models using Power BI and DAX.
• Connect Power BI to various data sources (Oracle, SQL Server, Excel, Azure, APIs, Databricks, Snowflake etc.).
• Optimize Power BI datasets and reports for performance and usability.
• Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security in all BI solutions.
• Provide end-user training and support for BI tools.
• Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and IT teams to ensure seamless data flow and integration.
• Stay up to date with Power BI updates and integrate new features into existing solutions.
• Participate in code reviews, testing, and deployment processes.

Qualifications

Required:    
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or related field.
• 6+ years of experience in Power BI development, data modeling, and visualization.
• Strong proficiency in DAX and Power Query (M).
• Microsoft Power Platform knowledge (Power Apps, Power Automate).
• Solid experience with SQL and relational databases.
• Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
• Proven experience in handling large datasets and developing performance-optimized dashboards.
• Experience with Power BI Service (publishing, gateways, workspaces).
• Familiarity with Agile methodologies and version control (e.g., Git).

Preferred Skills
• Experience with Azure Data Platform (Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL, etc.)
• Knowledge of other BI tools like Tableau, SSRS, or Qlik (optional but beneficial).
• Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics.
• Power BI certification (e.g., PL-300) is a plus.

Additional Information

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Senior Power BI Developer with 10+ years of expertise in Power BI, Power Apps, and SQL Server to join our dynamic team. This individual will play a key role in creating and optimizing business intelligence solutions, leading projects, and managing stakeholder relationships. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical skills and experience in managing teams, with a proven ability to work both as an individual contributor and as a collaborative team player. The candidate should be able to understand business workflow with respect to projects/program management and come up with proposals of continuous improvement by providing intelligent solution to existing issues. The candidate should be able to design the architectural framework for new requirements and should be able to provide algorithm to proceed using Power BI functional expertise.

Responsibilities
• Key Responsibilities:
• Power BI Development: Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards, reports, and data models. Utilize advanced Power BI features, including DAX, Power Query, and data transformations to deliver insightful analytics.
• Power Apps Development: Design and implement Power Apps solutions to automate business processes and improve operational efficiency, integrating them with backend systems where necessary.
• Power Automate Development: Experienced in leveraging Power Automate flows to streamline and automate data processes within Power BI environments. Skilled in creating seamless workflows to automate data refreshes, trigger notifications, and integrate external systems, ensuring real-time data accessibility and enhanced reporting
• SQL Server Expertise: Utilize SQL Server for database design, querying, and optimization. Ensure efficient data extraction and transformation for reporting purposes.
• Team Leadership & Collaboration: Lead a team of developers, providing guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise. Facilitate collaboration between team members to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality reports and applications.
• Stakeholder Management: Act as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders, understanding their needs and translating them into actionable BI solutions. Regularly update stakeholders on project progress and outcomes.
• Individual Contributor: While taking on a leadership role, the candidate will also be expected to work independently, particularly on complex reporting tasks or when tight deadlines arise.
• Data Integration & ETL: Integrate data from various sources (including but not limited to SQL Server, cloud-based systems, and third-party APIs) and ensure smooth ETL processes for data accuracy and consistency.
• Performance Tuning & Optimization: Ensure that Power BI reports and dashboards are optimized for performance, utilizing best practices for large datasets and complex queries.
• Documentation & Best Practices: Create and maintain technical documentation, ensuring adherence to best practices in data governance, report design, and security standards.

Skills Required:
• Power BI: Strong experience in developing Power BI reports and dashboards, including advanced features like Power Query, DAX, and Power BI Service.
• Power Apps: Proficiency in building and managing Power Apps applications to automate workflows and improve user productivity.
• Power Automate: Proficient in designing flows that enhance the efficiency of Power BI reports and dashboards by automating data ingestion, data transformation, and alert management, enabling a more responsive and dynamic business intelligence solution. (Lesser exp would be fine )
• SQL Server: Expertise in SQL Server database management, including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and optimizing database performance.
• Team Leadership: Proven experience in leading and mentoring a development team, ensuring the successful completion of projects while fostering a collaborative and productive environment.
• Stakeholder Management: Strong communication skills to interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and manage client expectations.
• Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify issues and propose effective solutions in a timely manner.
• Project Management: Ability to handle multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and prioritize effectively while working both independently and in a team setting.

Qualifications
• Must have skills:
• 10+ years of experience in designing, developing, and deploying Power BI solutions.
• Advanced proficiency in Power BI desktop, Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Power BI Report Server.
• Strong experience in working with large datasets and optimizing Power BI reports for performance.
• Expertise in SQL for complex data querying, transformations, and integrations with Power BI.
• Integrate Power BI with other systems and data sources (SQL, SharePoint, Excel, etc.) for seamless data flow.
• Design and develop custom Power Apps to automate business processes and improve operational efficiency.
• Create, manage, and optimize automated workflows using Power Automate to streamline tasks and integrate systems.

Good to have skills:
• Familiarity with other Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau, QlikView, or Looker, for cross-platform integration and versatility in BI environments.
• Knowledge of cloud platforms, such as Azure or AWS, and experience deploying and managing BI solutions in cloud-based environments.
• Experience with Power BI Embedded for integrating BI reports into third-party applications or web portals.
• Familiarity with PowerShell scripting for Power BI administration, report deployment, and automation tasks.
• Experience with data warehousing concepts and solutions, including ETL processes and tools like Azure Data Factory or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
• Knowledge of Data Governance and best practices in data security, privacy, and compliance for BI applications.
• Experience with Agile project management methodologies and working in cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.

Job Title: Staff BI developer (BI Engineer / Visualization developer)
Job Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

Team Summary:

The Risk and Identity Solutions (RaIS) team provides risk management services for banks, merchants, and other payment networks. Machine learning and AI models are the heart of the real-time insights used by our clients to manage risk. Created by the Visa Predictive Models (VPM) team, continual improvement and efficient deployment of these models is essential for our future success. To support our rapidly growing suite of predictive models we are looking for engineers who are passionate about managing large volumes of data, creating efficient, automated processes and standardizing ML/AI tools.

Primary responsibilities
• Possess a strong understanding of data interpretation, and the ability to effectively represent data using appropriate visualization techniques to deliver actionable insights.
• Focus on the user experience to design interactive prototype with strong understanding of business context and data following the industry and Visa best practices.
• Collect, analyze, transform, and interpret raw data from various sources. Design and develop BI solutions, data models and KPI measures to solve business problems.
• Ability to create visualizations that are user-friendly, intuitive, and tailored to the needs of the end user, ensuring that the visual elements effectively convey the intended message.
• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Power BI using visual elements like charts, graphs, maps, visual design principles.
• Ensure dashboards and reports are functioning correctly, meet user requirements, and provide accurate, up-to-date insights and perform bug triage by systematically testing data visualizations for accuracy and functionality, identifying issues, prioritizing their resolution based on severity and impact, and ensuring all bugs are fixed in a timely manner.
• Optimize dashboard performance by enhancing data processing speeds, improving query performance, and refining data models to ensure efficient, reliable, and timely data retrieval and analysis for business intelligence applications.
• Ensure the security of data and BI solutions, implement data security measures, complying with all relevant regulations and best practices.
• Set up and maintain the data visualization platform, manage access controls, and ensure system's overall health and performance using usage reports.
• Document all processes, methodologies, and instructions related to the BI solutions, create comprehensive and accessible documentation, conduct end-user training sessions, and ensure all documentation is consistently updated and available to relevant stakeholders.

Technical skills (Must have)
• Expertise in LOD( Level of Detail), DAX(Data Analysis Expressions), Power Query, M language, Tableau Prep to create measures and transform data.
• Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI.
• Advanced proficiency in SQL, including a deep understanding of queries, joins, stored procedures, triggers, and views, as well as experience in optimizing SQL for improved performance and efficiency.
• Comfortable with creating and maintaining database schemas, indexes, and writing complex SQL scripts for data analysis and extraction
• Experience in interacting with data warehouses and data lakes, utilizing tools like pyspark, Apache Hadoop Amazon Redshift, snowflake and Amazon S3 to ingest and extract data for insights.

Non-technical skills
• Experienced in working closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure understanding and usability of data visualizations.
• Continually stays updated with the latest trends and advancements in data visualization techniques and tools.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for managing relationships with stakeholders, strong presentation skills to effectively communicate data insights and visualizations to diverse audiences, with the ability to tailor the presentation to the audience's level of expertise.
• Ability to plan, prioritize, and manage time effectively, keep track of tasks and deadlines, maintain a tidy and systematic work environment, and coordinate resources to achieve goals in a timely and efficient manner.
• Take full responsibility for the BI projects, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of insights, and addressing any issues or inaccuracies in the data promptly and effectively.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

Qualifications
• 5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a BI Engineer / Visualization developer or similar role for 6+ years.

Additional Information

Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

2. Visit the Internal Mobility page on Inside Adobe to learn more about the process and set up a job alert for roles you’re interested in.

3. Check out these tips to help you prep for interviews.

4. If you are applying for a role outside of your current country, ensure you review the International Resources for Relocating Employees on Inside Adobe, including the impacts to your Benefits, AIP, Equity & Payroll.

Once you apply for a role via Workday, the Talent Team will reach out to you within 2 weeks. If you move into the official interview process with the hiring team, make sure you inform your manager so they can champion your career growth.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. About Us

Thoucentric is the Consulting arm of Xoriant, a prominent digital engineering services company with 5000+ employees. We are headquartered in Bangalore with presence across multiple locations in India, US, UK, Singapore & Australia Globally.

As the Consulting business of Xoriant, We help clients with Business Consulting, Program & Project Management, Digital Transformation, Product Management, Process & Technology Solutioning and Execution including Analytics & Emerging Tech areas cutting across functional areas such as Supply Chain, Finance & HR, Sales & Distribution across US, UK, Singapore and Australia. We are seeking a Senior BI Developer/Analyst to serve as a key liaison between the BI Development Manager and the BI Development team. This role combines technical expertise, leadership, and a deep understanding of business processes to deliver impactful business intelligence (BI) solutions. A critical responsibility of this position is supporting the organization by developing and maintaining the analytics and reporting necessary for Store Bonus generation, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.

Responsibilities:
• Lead and manage BI projects, ensuring they meet business requirements, deadlines, and quality standards
• Design, develop, and implement BI solutions, such as reports, dashboards, and data visualizations, using leading analytics tools
• Collaborate with the BI Development Manager to align BI solutions with organizational goals and strategic priorities
• Develop and maintain robust analytics and reporting frameworks to support the generation of Store Bonus information, ensuring timely and accurate delivery
• Allocate resources, assign tasks to BI developers, and oversee project execution to ensure efficiency and effectiveness
• Establish and enforce standards for data quality, governance, security, and reporting accuracy across BI solutions
• Define and optimize data pipelines, data models, and data architecture to enhance analytics performance and scalability
• Work with business stakeholders to gather and translate requirements into actionable technical specifications for the BI team
• Provide ongoing support to end-users by troubleshooting data and reporting issues, driving continuous improvement in analytics capabilities
• Ensure compliance with data governance, privacy, and quality standards in all BI solutions

Requirements
• Min 7+ years of relevant experience with proficiency in advanced BI tools (e.g., modern data visualization platforms) and experience with SQL or similar query languages
• Demonstrated experience in leading and mentoring a team of BI developers or analysts
• Proven ability to manage BI projects, including resource planning, task assignment, and on-time delivery
• Strong understanding of business processes, with the ability to align BI solutions to organizational objectives and critical needs such as Store Bonus generation
• Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, ensuring clear communication and alignment of goals
• Familiarity with data management, quality control, and privacy standards in BI environments
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on delivering actionable insights
• Qualifications: Bachelor's degree preferred
• Working time zone EST hours( 6.30 pm -2.30 am IST)

Benefits

Collaborative Environment: You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment or even abroad in one of our global centers.

Work-Life Balance: Accellor prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules, opportunities to work from home, and paid time off and holidays.

Professional Development: Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training, Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings.

Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Personal Accident Insurance, Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses.

The Role You’ll be joining our Power BI Development team where you’ll be primarily working on the visual design and UX of internal operational reports which are distributed across all YouGov business units and departments. Your main technical tool will be Power BI, and in collaboration with the entire development team you will be taking our existing report offerings to the next level. The role will report into the Finance Systems Team Lead. Office Location: Mumbai/Navi Mumbai Shift Timings: 11am – 8pm (Indian Standard Time) What will I be doing? Development and maintenance of Power BI reports and dashboards as part of an established suite of Standard report packs. Work closely with the Product Owner to deliver changes aligned to the product roadmap. Maintain and develop the Power BI reporting suite within an agile framework, ensuring all controls and governance are followed. Regression testing and impact analysis for all changes and creation for new test cases where applicable. Own deployment of reports and Update release notes, technical and end user documentation as part of the delivery cycle. Provide guidance and support to other junior developers. Identify and propose solutions and new features to improve end user experience. Qualifications What do I need to bring with me? 4-6 years of experience with Power BI (or similar reporting tool), specifically in the visual aspects of reports and dashboards. High level of attention to detail and accuracy alongside the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good working knowledge of DAX. Working experience of using source control tools (preferably GitLab). Working experience of DevOps and CI/CD principle (e.g., Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy, GitLab) Knowledge of BI testing framework (e.g., NBi). Knowledge of SQL. Ideally some knowledge and experience in the domains of Finance/Accounting, Sales/Marketing. Behavioral competencies First and foremost, have a customer-first attitude. Be a self-starter with a very high degree of initiative and proactivity. Work independently with minimal guidance. Learn new technologies fast and enjoy sharing newly gained insights. Actively follow industry trends and bring fresh ideas from the outside into your daily work. Be a natural mentor to more junior team members and help them to grow and develop by passing on knowledge and skills. Communication skills, both verbal and written: Outline, explain, and defend your ideas and solutions. Convey complex ideas in a clear and understandable way, enabling cross-functional interactions with non-technical departments and stakeholders. Collaborate: Be effective at forming strong relationships and gaining confidence of senior leadership. Company Description and Culture YouGov is a global online research company, offering insight into what the world thinks. We speak daily to our panel of over 27 million registered members to understand opinion and behaviors around the world. We have a strong reputation as a source of accurate data and we’re trusted by the world’s biggest brands to get it right, making us the most quoted market research source in the world. Why join YouGov? Join our global team to help us achieve our social mission: to make millions of people’s opinions heard for the benefit of our local, national, and international communities. Understanding diversity of opinion requires diversity of background. Although our global panel of millions of people worldwide powers our research, our biggest asset is our people. If our research is to be truly representative of what the world thinks, we need people from all walks of life to be part of the team to bring their perspective to the work we do. Life at YouGov We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless, and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics, and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, bringing these values into everything that we do. We strive to provide YouGovers with best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. We want our employees to have a sense of belonging and uniqueness in a supportive workplace, so they can bring their full selves to work. All employment decisions are made based on occupational qualifications, merit, and business need. Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Senior Power BI Developer with 10+ years of expertise in Power BI, Power Apps, and SQL Server to join our dynamic team. This individual will play a key role in creating and optimizing business intelligence solutions, leading projects, and managing stakeholder relationships. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical skills and experience in managing teams, with a proven ability to work both as an individual contributor and as a collaborative team player. The candidate should be able to understand business workflow with respect to projects/program management and come up with proposals of continuous improvement by providing intelligent solution to existing issues. The candidate should be able to design the architectural framework for new requirements and should be able to provide algorithm to proceed using Power BI functional expertise.

Responsibilities:
• Key Responsibilities:
• Power BI Development: Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards, reports, and data models. Utilize advanced Power BI features, including DAX, Power Query, and data transformations to deliver insightful analytics.
• Power Apps Development: Design and implement Power Apps solutions to automate business processes and improve operational efficiency, integrating them with backend systems where necessary.
• Power Automate Development: Experienced in leveraging Power Automate flows to streamline and automate data processes within Power BI environments. Skilled in creating seamless workflows to automate data refreshes, trigger notifications, and integrate external systems, ensuring real-time data accessibility and enhanced reporting
• SQL Server Expertise: Utilize SQL Server for database design, querying, and optimization. Ensure efficient data extraction and transformation for reporting purposes.
• Team Leadership & Collaboration: Lead a team of developers, providing guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise. Facilitate collaboration between team members to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality reports and applications.
• Stakeholder Management: Act as the primary point of contact for business stakeholders, understanding their needs and translating them into actionable BI solutions. Regularly update stakeholders on project progress and outcomes.
• Individual Contributor: While taking on a leadership role, the candidate will also be expected to work independently, particularly on complex reporting tasks or when tight deadlines arise.
• Data Integration & ETL: Integrate data from various sources (including but not limited to SQL Server, cloud-based systems, and third-party APIs) and ensure smooth ETL processes for data accuracy and consistency.
• Performance Tuning & Optimization: Ensure that Power BI reports and dashboards are optimized for performance, utilizing best practices for large datasets and complex queries.
• Documentation & Best Practices: Create and maintain technical documentation, ensuring adherence to best practices in data governance, report design, and security standards.

Skills Required:
• Power BI: Strong experience in developing Power BI reports and dashboards, including advanced features like Power Query, DAX, and Power BI Service.
• Power Apps: Proficiency in building and managing Power Apps applications to automate workflows and improve user productivity.
• Power Automate: Proficient in designing flows that enhance the efficiency of Power BI reports and dashboards by automating data ingestion, data transformation, and alert management, enabling a more responsive and dynamic business intelligence solution. (Lesser exp would be fine )
• SQL Server: Expertise in SQL Server database management, including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and optimizing database performance.
• Team Leadership: Proven experience in leading and mentoring a development team, ensuring the successful completion of projects while fostering a collaborative and productive environment.
• Stakeholder Management: Strong communication skills to interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and manage client expectations.
• Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify issues and propose effective solutions in a timely manner.
• Project Management: Ability to handle multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and prioritize effectively while working both independently and in a team setting.

Qualifications:
• Must have skills:
• 10+ years of experience in designing, developing, and deploying Power BI solutions.
• Advanced proficiency in Power BI desktop, Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Power BI Report Server.
• Strong experience in working with large datasets and optimizing Power BI reports for performance.
• Expertise in SQL for complex data querying, transformations, and integrations with Power BI.
• Integrate Power BI with other systems and data sources (SQL, SharePoint, Excel, etc.) for seamless data flow.
• Design and develop custom Power Apps to automate business processes and improve operational efficiency.
• Create, manage, and optimize automated workflows using Power Automate to streamline tasks and integrate systems.

Good to have skills:
• Familiarity with other Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau, QlikView, or Looker, for cross-platform integration and versatility in BI environments.
• Knowledge of cloud platforms, such as Azure or AWS, and experience deploying and managing BI solutions in cloud-based environments.
• Experience with Power BI Embedded for integrating BI reports into third-party applications or web portals.
• Familiarity with PowerShell scripting for Power BI administration, report deployment, and automation tasks.
• Experience with data warehousing concepts and solutions, including ETL processes and tools like Azure Data Factory or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
• Knowledge of Data Governance and best practices in data security, privacy, and compliance for BI applications.
• Experience with Agile project management methodologies and working in cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description

Senior Manager, BI Developer

The Opportunity
• Based in Hyderabad, join a global healthcare biopharma company and be part of a 130- year legacy of success backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare.
• Be part of an organisation driven by digital technology and data-backed approaches that support a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines, and animal health products.
• Drive innovation and execution excellence. Be a part of a team with passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision-making, and which creates custom software, allowing us to tackle some of the world's greatest health threats.

Our Technology Centres focus on creating a space where teams can come together to deliver business solutions that save and improve lives. An integral part of our company’s IT operating model, Tech Centres are globally distributed locations where each IT division has employees to enable our digital transformation journey and drive business outcomes. These locations, in addition to the other sites, are essential to supporting our business and strategy.

A focused group of leaders in each Tech Centre helps to ensure we can manage and improve each location, from investing in growth, success, and well-being of our people, to making sure colleagues from each IT division feel a sense of belonging to managing critical emergencies. And together, we must leverage the strength of our team to collaborate globally to optimize connections and share best practices across the Tech Centres.

Role Overview

The Company's Digital Products Engineering Team is hiring a Business Intelligence (BI) Development Senior Manager. This person will be responsible for managing and development of BI solutions required by company’s Manufacturing Division. They work closely with business stakeholders, data analysts, and developers to design, build, and maintain data-driven solutions that support decision-making and business operations. They will be responsible to both deliver solutions themselves and direct the work of a small group of junior BI developers.

What will you do in this role

Development and implementation of BI solutions to meet the organization's data analysis and reporting requirements. Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and understand their data and reporting needs. Design, develop, and manage BI reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using BI tools such as Power BI, Spotfire, Qlik Sense or QuickSight Provide technical leadership and guidance to a team of BI developers, ensuring the quality and timely delivery of BI projects. Conduct data analysis and modeling to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business performance improvements. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to data integration, data quality, and performance optimization. Stay abreast of the latest BI technologies and best practices to continuously improve and enhance the organization's BI capabilities.

What should you have
• Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, Information Systems or any related field.
• 5+ years’ experience in BI development and data analysis, including hands-on experience with BI tools and technologies such Power BI, Spotfire, Qliksense or QuickSight
• Proficient in SQL, data modeling, and database design concepts.
• Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and architectures.
• Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to guide and mentor a team of developers.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in English.

Our technology teams operate as business partners, proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver services and solutions that help everyone be more productive and enable innovation.

Who we are

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Job Title: Senior Power BI Developer - DAX Power BI
Company: AKSHAYA BUSINESS IT SOLUTIONS PRIVATE LIMITED
Job Description:
Job Title : Senior Power BI Developer with Power Pages/Power Apps portals

Location : Hyderabad

Experience : 8+ Years

Responsibilities :

- Lead the design, development, and deployment of interactive and visually compelling Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders.

- Develop and implement robust data models in Power BI, optimizing for performance and scalability.

- Write complex DAX queries to perform calculations, create measures, and enhance data analysis capabilities within Power BI.

- Connect Power BI to various data sources, including databases, data warehouses, cloud services, and APIs.

- Ensure data quality and accuracy within Power BI reports through data validation and cleansing techniques.

- Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and translate them into technical specifications for Power BI solutions.

- Design, develop, and customize Power Pages (Power Apps portals) to create secure and engaging external-facing web applications.

- Configure portal components, including entities, forms, views, lists, and web templates within Power Pages.

- Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms within Power Pages to control access to portal content and functionalities.

- Integrate Power Pages with other Microsoft Power Platform components, such as Power Apps, Power Automate, and Dynamics 365.

- Customize the look and feel of Power Pages portals using CSS, JavaScript, and Liquid templates.

- Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power BI reports and Power Pages portals.

- Optimize the performance of both Power BI solutions and Power Pages portals.

- Stay up-to-date with the latest features and capabilities of Power BI and Power Pages.

- Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to development best practices.

- Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers within the team.

- Contribute to the development of technical documentation for Power BI solutions and Power Pages portals.

Technical Skills :

- Deep expertise in Microsoft Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and Power BI Report Server.

- Strong understanding of data modeling concepts, including star schema and snowflake schema.

- Excellent proficiency in writing complex DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for calculations, measures, and calculated columns.

- Experience in connecting to and transforming data from various data sources (e.g. , SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, Dataverse, Excel, CSV, REST APIs).

- Solid understanding of data visualization best practices and principles.

- Experience in implementing row-level security and other security features within Power BI.

- Knowledge of Power Query (M language) for data transformation and manipulation.

- Experience with Power BI Embedded is a plus.

- Familiarity with Power BI administration and governance.

- Strong hands-on experience in designing, developing, and deploying Power Pages (formerly Power Apps portals).

- Expertise in configuring and customizing portal entities, forms, views, and lists.

- Proficiency in using Liquid templates for advanced portal customization.

- Experience with implementing custom CSS and JavaScript to enhance the portal's user interface and functionality.

- Understanding of portal authentication and authorization mechanisms, including configuration with Azure AD and other identity providers.

- Experience in integrating Power Pages with Dataverse (Common Data Service).

- Familiarity with Power Apps portals web API for programmatic interaction with portal data.

- Knowledge of Power Apps portals administration and management.

- Experience with integrating Power Pages with Power Automate workflows.

Preferred Skills :

- Experience with other Microsoft Power Platform components (Power Apps, Power Automate).

- Knowledge of Dynamics 365 and its integration with Power BI and Power Pages.

- Familiarity with front-end web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

- Experience with Azure services relevant to data and analytics (e.g. , Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics).

- Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.

Qualifications :

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.

- Minimum of 8 years of professional experience as a Power BI Developer.

- Proven experience in developing and deploying Power Pages (Power Apps portals).

- Strong portfolio showcasing Power BI dashboards and Power Pages portals developed.

- Relevant Microsoft certifications (e.g. , Microsoft Certified : Data Analyst Associate, Microsoft Certified : Power Platform Developer Associate) are a plus

Description

When it comes to IT solution providers, there are a lot of choices. But when it comes to providers with innovative and differentiating end-to-end service offerings, there’s really only one: Zones – First Choice for IT.TM

• Created Scorecards, Bookmarks, ToolTip, conditional formatting, Drill Down Reports, Drill Through Report.

(ref:hirist.tech)

The Role You’ll be joining our Power BI Development team where you’ll be primarily working on the visual design and UX of internal operational reports which are distributed across all YouGov business units and departments. Your main technical tool will be Power BI, and in collaboration with the entire development team you will be taking our existing report offerings to the next level. The role will report into the Finance Systems Team Lead. Office Location: Mumbai/Navi Mumbai Shift Timings: 11am – 8pm (Indian Standard Time) What will I be doing? Development and maintenance of Power BI reports and dashboards as part of an established suite of Standard report packs. Work closely with the Product Owner to deliver changes aligned to the product roadmap. Maintain and develop the Power BI reporting suite within an agile framework, ensuring all controls and governance are followed. Regression testing and impact analysis for all changes and creation for new test cases where applicable. Own deployment of reports and Update release notes, technical and end user documentation as part of the delivery cycle. Provide guidance and support to other junior developers. Identify and propose solutions and new features to improve end user experience. Qualifications What do I need to bring with me? 4-6 years of experience with Power BI (or similar reporting tool), specifically in the visual aspects of reports and dashboards. High level of attention to detail and accuracy alongside the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Good working knowledge of DAX. Working experience of using source control tools (preferably GitLab). Working experience of DevOps and CI/CD principle (e.g., Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy, GitLab) Knowledge of BI testing framework (e.g., NBi). Knowledge of SQL. Ideally some knowledge and experience in the domains of Finance/Accounting, Sales/Marketing. Behavioral competencies First and foremost, have a customer-first attitude. Be a self-starter with a very high degree of initiative and proactivity. Work independently with minimal guidance. Learn new technologies fast and enjoy sharing newly gained insights. Actively follow industry trends and bring fresh ideas from the outside into your daily work. Be a natural mentor to more junior team members and help them to grow and develop by passing on knowledge and skills. Communication skills, both verbal and written: Outline, explain, and defend your ideas and solutions. Convey complex ideas in a clear and understandable way, enabling cross-functional interactions with non-technical departments and stakeholders. Collaborate: Be effective at forming strong relationships and gaining confidence of senior leadership. Company Description and Culture YouGov is a global online research company, offering insight into what the world thinks. We speak daily to our panel of over 27 million registered members to understand opinion and behaviors around the world. We have a strong reputation as a source of accurate data and we’re trusted by the world’s biggest brands to get it right, making us the most quoted market research source in the world. Why join YouGov? Join our global team to help us achieve our social mission: to make millions of people’s opinions heard for the benefit of our local, national, and international communities. Understanding diversity of opinion requires diversity of background. Although our global panel of millions of people worldwide powers our research, our biggest asset is our people. If our research is to be truly representative of what the world thinks, we need people from all walks of life to be part of the team to bring their perspective to the work we do. Life at YouGov We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless, and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics, and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, bringing these values into everything that we do. We strive to provide YouGovers with best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. We want our employees to have a sense of belonging and uniqueness in a supportive workplace, so they can bring their full selves to work. All employment decisions are made based on occupational qualifications, merit, and business need. Job Title: Power BI Developer | Bangalore Candidates only
Job Description:
Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Power BI Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Power BI Developer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and deploying sophisticated Power BI solutions that drive data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into effective, visually appealing, and highly performant Power BI reports.

Note: This role requires the candidate to work in our (South) Bangalore office at least for 4 out of 5 days. Local candidates preferred. No relocation assistance provided.

Responsibilities
• Data Modeling and Analysis:
• Design and implement robust data models to efficiently store and retrieve data from various sources.
• Utilize advanced DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) to create complex calculations and insights.
• Leverage Power Query (M language) to transform and clean data effectively.
• Report Development and Visualization:
• Develop visually appealing and interactive Power BI reports using a variety of visualizations.
• Optimize report performance and ensure smooth user experience.
• Implement Row-Level Security (RLS) to control data access and maintain data privacy.
• Power BI Service Administration:
• Manage and administer Power BI Service, including capacity planning, licensing, and deployment strategies.
• Understand different tiers, capacities, and licensing options to optimize costs and performance.
• Integration and Automation:
• Integrate Power BI with other Microsoft tools like Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, and Azure.
• Automate data ingestion and report generation processes using ETL tools and scripting languages.
• Cloud Platform Expertise:
• Leverage cloud platforms like MS Fabric, Data Factory, and Data Lake to enhance data pipelines and scalability.
• Performance Optimization:
• Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in reports and data models.
• Implement optimization techniques to ensure efficient data processing and visualization.
• Collaboration and Mentoring:
• Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable insights.
• Mentor and guide junior team members on Power BI best practices and techniques.
• Technical Leadership:
• Understand requirements, design documentation and standards for the BI team.
• Provide hands-on expertise in design, development, testing, and UAT.
• Deploy Power BI reports and dashboards to production workspaces in Power BI Service cloud.

Qualifications
• 2 to 6 years of hands-on experience with Power BI and related technologies.
• Advanced proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX, Power Query, and visualization techniques.
• Strong SQL skills for data querying and manipulation.
• Experience with ETL processes and data integration.
• In-depth understanding of Power BI Service, including administration, capacity planning, and licensing.
• Proficiency in Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation.
• Experience with cloud platforms like MS Fabric, Data Factory, and Data Lake.
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with R or Python for custom visual development.
• Certification in Power BI or related technologies.

Job Benefits
• This position is required to work in our Office in (South) Bangalore
• Apply ONLY if you are able to work 4 to 5 days from office (1 day Hybrid possible)
• No Remote work possible.
• Local candidates preferred. No relocation assistance provided.

Experience: 2-5 Years
Notice Period: Immediate
Work Mode: Remote
Job Description
We are seeking an experienced and talented Power BI Developer to join our analytics team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in data visualization, data modeling, and business intelligence using Microsoft Power BI. This role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact, visually compelling reports and dashboards that empower data-driven decisions across the organization.
Key Skills:
1. Proficiency in Power BI: Expertise in Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service, with a strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
2. DAX and M Language: Advanced skills in DAX for complex calculations and M language for data transformations.
3. SQL & Data Querying: Strong SQL skills to efficiently extract and process data from multiple sources.
4. Data Warehousing & ETL: Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes, ensuring data consistency across models.
5. Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to approach complex business questions with data-driven solutions.
6. Communication & Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
7. Power BI Security & Governance: Experience in implementing security measures within Power BI to ensure proper data governance is a plus.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Report Development: Design, develop, and deploy interactive Power BI reports and dashboards that offer clear and actionable insights into business performance.
2. Data Modeling & Integration: Create and maintain complex data models within Power BI, integrating data from various sources including SQL Server, Excel, and cloud-based databases.
3. Data Querying & Optimization: Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data, ensuring efficient data processing and accurate reporting.
4. Collaboration with Stakeholders: Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective BI solutions, ensuring that deliverables meet business needs and objectives.
5. Performance Monitoring & Troubleshooting: Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize Power BI reports, data refresh schedules, and performance, ensuring consistent and reliable access to insights.
6. Data Security & Governance: Implement security measures, including role-based access control, to protect data integrity and ensure reports are accessible only to authorized users.
7. User Training & Support: Provide training and ongoing support to end-users on Power BI tools and best practices, enhancing the team's ability to use data effectively.

Job Title: DE - NCLC - Power BI Developer - GDSN02
Job Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Power BI Lead/Lead Data Analyst

As part of our GDS Consulting team, you will be part of Digital & Emerging team delivering specific to Microsoft account. You will be working on latest Microsoft BI technologies and will collaborate with other teams within Consulting services.

The opportunity

We’re looking for resources with expertise in Microsoft BI, Power BI, Azure Data Factory to join the group of our Data Visualization team. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a leading firm whilst being instrumental in the growth of our service offering.

Your Key Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards that are visually compelling and functionally robust.
• Create and maintain data models, ensuring optimal performance and usability.
• Build and manage Power BI Dataflows to standardize and transform data.
• Utilize Power Query for data transformation and cleansing.
• Develop efficient data models to support self-service reporting and advanced analytics.
• Optimize data models for performance and scalability.
• Leverage Azure SQL and other Azure services to integrate and manage data for reporting and analytics.
• Collaborate with data engineers to design ETL pipelines for batch and real-time data.
• Work with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
• Partner with data engineers, analysts, and other teams to ensure cohesive data strategies.
• Implement and enforce best practices for Power BI governance, including dataset management, version control, and role-based access.
• Ensure compliance with organizational data policies and standards.
• Provide guidance and training to junior developers and analysts on Power BI tools and techniques.
• Act as a subject matter expert for Power BI within the organization

Skills And Attributes For Success
• Collaborating with other members of the engagement team to plan the engagement and develop work program timelines, risk assessments and other documents/templates.
• Able to manage Senior stakeholders.
• Experience in leading teams to execute high quality deliverables within stipulated timeline.

Must-Have Skills:
• Expertise in Power BI, including Power BI Fabric, Power Query, and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions).
• Strong experience in data modelling for Power BI solutions.
• Proficiency in creating and managing Power BI Dataflows.
• Hands-on experience with SQL for data integration and management.

Good-to-Have Skills:
• Knowledge of Azure Data Factory (ADF) for ETL processes.
• Familiarity with Azure services like Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS), Azure Databricks, or Azure Synapse.
• Experience with Dataverse for data integration.
• Programming expertise in PySpark for advanced data transformations.
• Understanding of cloud and data security best practices. One or more of the following databases: Oracle, SQL, Azure SQL.
• Familiarity with or experience using Co-pilot for enhanced collaboration and development.

Certifications (Preferred):
• DP-600: Designing and Implementing a Data Platform Solution.
• PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst.
• Excellent Written and Communication Skills
• Ability to deliver technical demonstrations
• Quick learner with “can do” attitude
• Demonstrating and applying strong project management skills, inspiring teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members

To qualify for the role, you must have
• 3.5-8 years of hands-on experience with Power BI and related technologies.
• Experience in implementing end-to-end business intelligence solutions.
• Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Ideally, you’ll also have
• Analytical ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks into manageable work products.
• Can operate independently or with minimum supervision

What Working At EY Offers

At EY, we’re dedicated to helping our clients, from start–ups to Fortune 500 companies — and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.

You get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. We value our employees and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will quickly grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments. Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Plus, we offer:
• Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
• Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
• The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Why work for us

Day in, day out, our teams deliver some of the UK’s most ambitious, exciting and meaningful projects; developing, building and maintaining the vital infrastructure that supports national economies and strengthens communities.

Why join us?

As if contributing to and supporting work that makes life better for millions wasn’t rewarding enough, we offer a full range of benefits too. You’ll have the freedom to shape the package that’s right for you and your life. Here are some of our key benefits:

- Smart working, giving you more flexibility such as staggered start and finish times, with up to 40% remote working, where roles allow.

About us

Balfour Beatty’s Power Transmission & Distribution teams work with regional, national and international electricity network owners and operators to provide technical engineering solutions across the full spectrum of the electricity grid, including overhead lines, cabling, substations and distribution networks.

From scoping and feasibility, to design, construction and on-going maintenance, our in-house experts, flexible resources and industry-leading innovations support customers in the development of some of the UK’s most ambitious power transmission and distribution projects.

Job Title: Power BI Developer, Technology, Data and Innovation
Job Description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Power BI Developer, you will be the key conduit between our business units, ensuring comprehensive understanding and translation of requirements for new deliverables that provide tangible business value. Your role will involve harnessing your SQL and Power BI background to offer data-driven insights and analysis that underpin decision-making processes. The successful candidate will be proficient in managing and interpreting data sets and will leverage this expertise to assist the business in making informed decisions. Exceptional communication skills are a must, as the role involves presenting findings effectively to a range of stakeholders
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Report Production:

Requirement Translation:

• Translate business needs into comprehensive reporting and dashboard requirements.

• Collaborate closely with key business stakeholders to understand and document their reporting requirements.

Design and Development:

• Design, build, and evolve Power BI reports and dashboards, ensuring they are produced timely and accurately.

• Liaise with key stakeholders to confirm that the reports meet their needs and are delivered as required. ·

Data Insight and Analysis:

• Provide actionable insights from data and reporting.

• Develop and maintain comprehensive reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and support strategic planning.

Data Analysis: ·

• Undertake impact assessment, issue investigation, analysis, and resolution to maintain current reports and support develop new reports.

• Provide adhoc datasets to answer business questions.

• Collect, analyse, and interpret data from various sources to provide insights for decision-making.

Stakeholder Management:

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data and reporting needs.

• Address any questions or concerns raised by stakeholders and provide additional information as required.

Compliance and Quality Assurance:

• Regulatory Compliance:

• Ensure all reports comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
QUALIFICATIONS

• A relevant degree or professional certifications (desirable)

KNOWLEDGE

• SQL (essential)

• Power BI (essential)

• DAX / MQuery

• Snowflake experience (desirable)

• Stakeholder management skills

• Data modelling

• star schema
EXPERIENCE

• Insurance or Finance background (desirable)

• Demonstrated experience with data management and reporting tools (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Tableau).

• Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for driving innovation through data.
BENEFITS

On top of a competitive salary we offer a fantastic benefits package including:

• 10% pension contribution from Miller. In addition, Miller will match any employee contributions up to 5%.

• Private Medical Insurance

• Medicare cash plan

• Minimum of 25 days annual leave (with flexibility to buy more)

• Life Assurance

• Income Protection

• Critical Illness cover

• Enhanced Maternity, Paternity Adoption and Shared Parental Leave

Job Summary

An exciting new opportunity has arisen for a Specialist Data Analyst (Power BI) to support Digital Health and Care Wales in the use of data to improve the delivery of patient care and services.

This post will play a key role in maximizing the potential of the local and national data collected by DHCW, contributing to enhanced data analysis to support the information needs within the organisation.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual who has experience in successfully leading on projects, along with considerable experience and knowledge of developing and presenting information using the Microsoft Power Platform (in particular Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI), to various audiences at all levels.

The candidate should have proven IT skills in an analytical capacity i.e. good working knowledge of relational databases and information systems with data retrieval skills using software packages, such as Microsoft Structured Query Language.

The candidate should enjoy working as part of a busy team and be able to demonstrate a commitment to delivering a high-quality service. The successful applicant will need to be willing to learn new skills and maintain positive and constructive relationships with a wide range of individuals and organisations and be able to prioritise their own work.

Main duties of the job

As a Specialist Data Analyst (Power BI), your approach will be flexible and innovative.

You will play a key role in exploiting data within DHCW and enhancing the data analysis, interpretation, and presentation skills in the DHCW Corporate Power BI Team, including influencing the development of relevant datasets to appropriately reflect the information needs of DHCW directorates and their initiatives.

Primary Duties Are

To co-ordinate the delivery and processing of highly complex, sensitive data, information, and business intelligence in relation to all Directorates / Stakeholders.

To carry out innovative analyses and produce reports into the quality of data held by DHCW and ensure that analysts are aware of potentially problematic areas using Power Platform tools (Power BI, Power Automate and Power Apps)

To lead on the specialist area of Power BI at a corporate level, ensuring standardised usage, quality assurance and best practice are in place and always adhered to

To lead on the development and roll out of the Assurance Framework for Power BI Development and Publishing at a corporate level, providing guidance and support to customers at all levels across DHCW.

Provide guidance on data and analytical matters to both internal and external customers and junior members of staff.

About Us

Digital Health and Care Wales (DHCW) is an expert national body and part of NHS Wales. We work in partnership with NHS Wales colleagues and other key stakeholders to provide national digital and data services which support the delivery of health and social care in Wales. Modern health and care services depend on good digital tools, data and information. DHCW runs or works with more than 100 services and delivers major national digital transformation programmes to support this. In addition, DHCW provides expert advice in relation to cyber security and information governance. We give frontline staff the digital tools which help them provide safer and more efficient care. We are also giving patients and the public digital tools to better manage their own health and wellbeing, empowering people to live healthier lives. We put people at the heart of what we do, working to the highest standards to deliver quality and make digital a force for good in health and care.

Working for DHCW offers lots of employee benefits, including flexible working, a competitive salary, 28 days of annual leave plus Bank Holidays and opportunities for career development. We are committed to recognising and celebrating our staff as the most valuable part of our organisation.

Job Title: Lead Power BI and Analytics Specialist
Job Description:
Our client stands at the forefront of the property sector, renowned for delivering innovative solutions and exceptional services. Their commitment to fostering innovation and maintaining the highest standards of excellence defines their approach. They are currently seeking a skilled and motivated Power BI and Analytics Specialist to join their team and harness data to drive strategic decisions and enhance business performance.

As a Power BI and Analytics Specialist, you will play a vital role in the development, implementation, and maintenance of data analytics solutions using Power BI, SQL, and Azure Synapse. You will collaborate closely with various departments to identify their data requirements and provide actionable insights that support key business objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

• Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights for various business units.

• Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective data visualizations.

• Utilize SQL to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into Power BI and Azure Synapse.

• Develop and maintain data models and datasets within Power BI and Azure Synapse.

• Optimize and manage data workflows to ensure efficient data processing and reporting.

• Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security in all analytics solutions.

• Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI and analytics tools.

• Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our analytics capabilities.

Qualifications:

• 5+ years of experience in data analytics and business intelligence, with a strong focus on Power BI.

• Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL).

• Experience with Azure Synapse Analytics or similar cloud-based data warehousing solutions.

• Strong understanding of data modeling, data visualization, and dashboard design principles.

• Ability to work with large datasets and complex data environments.

• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

• Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Skills:

• Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate, Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate, or similar.

• Experience with other data analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Tableau, Qlik).

• Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and scripting.

• Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools.

How to Apply: If you are a skilled Power BI and Analytics Specialist looking to make a significant impact with your data expertise, we would love to hear from you. Please submit CV below.

Apply now and join the team to drive data-driven success and innovation.

A rapidly growing business are looking for a Power BI enthusiast to join their Data team in the role of "Senior Data Analyst", as they embark upon a large-scale technology transformation and strive to become truly data-driven.

You will focus largely on the design and delivery of insightful Power BI dashboards for various business groups. You will work directly with stakeholders to uncover requirements, build appropriate reporting solutions, and then present actionable insights to senior leaders to bring about real change.

As a Senior member of the Data team, you will mentor Junior colleagues, foster a growth-orientated culture, and will take a leadership role in driving data initiatives forward. There is already a clear path for progression with the idea being that, in time, this role will turn into a Data Lead role.

This role would be well-suited to someone who is really passionate about Power BI and the power of story-telling with data, where you will have endless opportunities for growth - with plans to harness the latest Microsoft technologies including Fabric, there really couldn't be a better time to join this business!

This role is remote, so is open to candidates across the UK, with an in-person team meet-up once per month to socialise with your colleagues (expenses paid).

Requirements:
• Experience developing end-to-end Power BI dashboards including use of DAX
• Strong SQL skills - including querying and data modelling
• Desire to mentor junior team members
• Experience working on Azure or other cloud platforms would be helpful but not essential
• Experience with scripting languages like Python or R would be helpful but not essential
• Strong communication and stakeholder management skills

Salary:
• Salary from £40-60,000 depending on your level of experience

Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Senior Power BI Developer
Permanent
Hybrid (1-2 days per week in London or Portsmouth offices)
£50 - 60K basic + benefits
Do you have a background in Power BI development and reporting, along with SQL, DAX + Power Query experience and ETL/ELT tools inc SSIS or Azure Data Factory in an MSP environment?

Responsible for:
Designing, developing, and optimising Power BI dashboards and reports to provide business insights. Working closely with stakeholders to understand data needs, integrate data sources, and build robust BI solutions that support decision-making.

Scope:
The focus of this role is to work with key business stakeholders within IT, and across the business to implement Power BI solutions and a CoE (Community of Excellence). This role will initially be focused on the processes within Finance, Lead to Cash and Hire to Retire.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI reports and dashboards.
• Implement DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for complex calculations and measures.
• Create visually appealing, user-friendly data visualizations for business users.
• Develop data models in Power BI using Power Query (M language).
• Optimise data transformations, relationships, and performance tuning.
• Connect Power BI with Azure Synapse, and APIs.
• Write advanced SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and aggregation.
• Work with Stored Procedures, Views, and Query Optimisation.
• Optimize Power BI report performance (reducing load times, improving DAX efficiency).

Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.

With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 103,000 employees spanning 75 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.

Data Analyst, Power BI | Investment Management - Trading Platform | London, Hybrid | up to £100k + Bonus, Benefits

A leading global asset manager, responsible for assets under management across liability driven investment (LDI), cashflow-driven investing (CDI) and longevity hedging, currency management, fixed income, absolute return, multi-asset and specialist investment strategies. Is looking to add to their Data team, by hiring a Data Analyst, coming from a financial services / Trading House background with knowledge around Risk, regulations, Compliance, Trade Surveillance etc...

The Data Analyst will join the Data Centre of Excellence, encompassing Data Analysis, Data Architecture, Data Intelligence and Machine Learning experts. This Data team helps the Investment Management House make use of their data to help make investment and risk decisions.

As a Data analyst you will be responsible for proactively managing aspects of the data acquisition and commercial lifecycle to create P&L impacting value for the investment business. Specifically within compliance, understanding the data needed from the business to make decisions, bridging the gap between the Business & Data technical experts.

Who we are…

GlobalData is a specialist information services business on a mission to help our clients decode the future, make better decisions and reach more customers. Using our unique data, expert analysis and innovative solutions we’re able to create trusted intelligence on the world’s largest industries for thousands of companies, government organisations and industry professionals in one fully integrated platform.

We began our journey in 2016, by combining a diverse range of specialist information services companies, many with decades of trusted customer relationships and deep sector specialisms. Today, we believe in the power of collaboration and operate as a single company, with more than 3,500 colleagues worldwide, across 20+ industries, delivering value for over 5,000 customers globally. The combination of deep expertise within the industries we serve and an innovative mindset, are unique and fundamental to ongoing success of our business.

Why join GlobalData?

GlobalData is at a pivotal point in its growth journey. Following multiple acquisitions and having recently received transformational investment we need curious, ambitious, courageous people to support us in achieving our vision of becoming the world’s trusted source of strategic industry intelligence.

Our big ambitions mean that life at GlobalData is fast paced, entrepreneurial and rewarding. We recognise the collective power of our people and it’s the collaboration of our teams that have shaped our success and will continue to do so in the future. Our colleagues are led by a strong management team who offer training, development and coaching that allows both early and experienced talent to progress in their career.

The role…

We are seeking a highly skilled BI Developer to help drive data driven decision making. The successful candidate will play a key role in automating our reporting processes, moving away from manual Excel reporting towards automated data insights through Power BI. This position requires a strong understanding of business requirements, data modelling, and project management to enhance our reporting capabilities.

What you'll be doing...
• Understand Business Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business needs and requirements related to reporting.
• Taxonomy Development and Management: Design, develop, and maintain data taxonomies to ensure consistent categorisation and organisation of business data. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and refine taxonomy structures that align with business needs and objectives.
• Work alongside our Data Engineer: To ensure our complex datasets are optimised for reporting.
• Build Reporting in Power BI: Create dynamic and insightful Power BI reports that facilitate data-driven decision-making.
• Project Management: Manage reporting projects, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to project goals.
• Process Improvement: Work closely with business leaders to identify opportunities for process improvement in reporting and analytics.
• Challenge Business Views: Provide critical insights and challenge existing business perceptions to enhance decision-making processes.
• Business Partner with HR: Become a subject matter expert (SME) for reporting, offering previously undiscovered insights to GlobalData.

What we're looking for...

Experience:
• Minimum of 5 of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a related field.
• Proven experience with Power BI is critical.
• Background in design is desired.
• Proficiency in SQL is desired.
• Familiarity with Snowflake & dbt is desirable.
• Experience in end-to-end report creation process, including requirement gathering, modelling and report creation.

Skills:
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
• Understanding of Kimball methodology.
• Project management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
• Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.

GlobalData believes strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. GlobalData is determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

To find out more and to apply to our roles please visit careers.globaldata.com.

Job Title: Contract Power BI Developer - Outside IR35

The role would involve developing complex data models and subsequent visualisation and reporting dashboards. Experience in using both data preparation and blending tools, such as Alteryx, as well as industry leading visualisation tools, such as Tableau or Power BI, is essential.
