Title: PowerBi/Fabric DeveloperLocation: Dallas TX (Hybrid)Duration: 6+ Month Contractif interested send resumes to rcasseb@apexsystems.comAbout the Role:We are seeking a Power BI Developer with strong administration expertise to lead the redesign, optimization, and governance of an enterprise-wide Power BI environment. This role is crucial in preparing the organization for a migration from Power BI to Microsoft Fabric by establishing data governance standards, streamlining workspaces, and developing scalable, enterprise-grade reports and dashboards. The organization currently has 146,000+ personal Power BI workspaces with no clear governance, leading to inconsistent reporting, security risks, and inefficiencies. The ideal candidate will take ownership of cleaning up the Power BI environment, implementing governance policies, and ensuring a smooth transition to Microsoft Fabric while mentoring internal teams on best practices. This is an opportunity to work in a rapidly modernizing data environment with Azure cloud, Databricks, and AI/ML integration on the roadmap. Key Responsibilities:Power BI Development & Administration:• Redesign and optimize the existing Power BI workspaces with enterprise standards in mind.• Identify and clean up unnecessary or redundant workspaces before migration.• Implement data governance policies, ensuring structured deployment, security, and access management.• Develop scalable and standardized Power BI reports, dashboards, and datasets to improve data-driven decision-making.• Work with the enterprise data team to integrate Power BI with Azure data services.• Administer Power BI security settings, user access controls, and workspace permissions to align with enterprise IT policies.• Monitor Power BI performance and optimize data models for efficiency and speed.• Document standards, processes, and best practices for Power BI usage and governance. Migration to Microsoft Fabric:• Lead the migration from Power BI to Microsoft Fabric, ensuring minimal disruption.• Work with IT teams to define the roadmap and best practices for a structured migration.• Ensure proper data integrity and governance compliance during the transition.• Provide training and knowledge transfer to the internal data team for long-term maintenance. Collaboration & Mentorship:•Work closely with business stakeholders and data teams to understand reporting needs and deliver actionable insights.•Educate and mentor internal data teams on Power BI governance, administration, and best practices.•Support cross-functional teams in adopting Azure-based data solutions and integrating Power BI with cloud infrastructure. Must-Have Skills & Experience:• Power BI expertise – strong experience in developing enterprise-level Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models.• Power BI administration – experience managing permissions, workspace organization, and governance policies.• DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Service – advanced hands-on experience.• Microsoft Fabric migration – knowledge of or experience with transitioning from Power BI to Microsoft Fabric.• Azure Data Services – familiarity with Azure SQL, Data Factory, Synapse, or other Azure data platforms.• Data governance & security – strong understanding of workspace governance, role-based access controls (RBAC), and enterprise data policies.• SQL proficiency – ability to query, transform, and optimize data from structured sources. Nice-to-Have Skills:• Databricks – experience working with big data environments and advanced analytics.• AI/ML knowledge – understanding how AI/ML models can be integrated into data visualization strategies.• Cloud architecture – experience working with Azure-based cloud environments.• DevOps & CI/CD pipelines – experience with automated data deployments and version control for reports.Notes from Heather:Overview:· Immature data environment that is going through a transformation to optimize/modernize· Currently, a Microsoft shop, on-prem and moving to Azure cloud environment· Tammye (CDO) is taking on the brunt of strategic work and education of her current team· Majority of team has limited background to tools outside of the current stack, so need to add knowledge base around Azure and azure data services, machine learning, data governance, pipeline development, etc.Power BI Administrator· Power BI is deployed and used, but no governance or standards were set· Deployment of the tool was not done with an enterprise perspectiveo Stood it up and gave to the business – no guides or standards seto Currently have 146,000 personal workspaces (don’t know/track who is using)o Some of the end points exposed to the public· Don’t have Standard data management practices· Have enterprise gateway to facilitate - but don’t know who is using it· Will be converting from Power BI to Microsoft Fabric; in theory should be an easy conversion, but with the messy deployment a lot needs to be fixed and cleaned up prior· Day to Day:· Design and help with enterprise deployment of Power BI to Fabric· Will convert from PowerBI to Microsoft Fabric (more comprehensive data platform with PowerBI premium capabilities)· Prior to converting, will need to redesign the current PowerBI set up and workspaces with enterprise standards in mindo With 146,000+ don’t want to convert unnecessary workspaces· Set standard data management practices · Need the resource to come in, lead this conversion, then knowledge transfer to current data team to maintain Must Have:· Power BI expertise – experience with wide deployment is helpful· Microsoft Fabric – migration from PowerBI is helpful· DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Service· Azure· Knowledge of data governance policies and practices Nice to Have:· Databricks – strong plusif interested send resumes to rcasseb@apexsystems.com EEO EmployerApex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Job Title: Systems Analyst Power BI Developer Company: Sugpiat Defense, LLC

Reports To: PM Location: MCB Quantico Virginia - Requires 2 days on site per week

BACKGROUND

The mission of NCIS is to investigate and defeat criminal, terrorist, and foreign intelligence threats to the United States Navy and Marine Corps, wherever they operate, ashore or afloat. NCIS Civilian and Marine Corps Special Agents' current mission includes criminal investigations, force protection, cross-border drug enforcement, anti-terrorism, counter-terrorism, procurement fraud, computer crime and counter-intelligence.

POSITION SUMMARY

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in integrating data from a wide variety of sources and developing highly functional analytical reports and dashboards/visualizations in Microsoft Power BI.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Responsibilities
• This position will be responsible for producing data and metrics that are intended to provide decision support information specifically for managerial use, including performance measurement, cost management, calculating reimbursements, program authorization, modification, and HR decisions. The resulting product(s) will increase NCIS's visibility and understanding of analytics and metrics and enable the services to improve their ability to make informed decisions.
• This position will perform all programming and data sourcing responsibilities necessary to sustain and create new analytics reports and tools developed with Power BI and will continually identify performance measures that meaningfully relate to program output

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
• 5+ years of experience with development languages required to support Power BI, including DAX, M, R, SQL, JavaScript, ASP.Net, HTML and JQuery.
• 5+ years of experience designing and developing solutions with Microsoft Power BI.
• Or minimum of 5 years of experience developing reports in Business Intelligence software such as Qilkview or Tableau
• Experience designing and implementing interfaces for Power BI to data sources such as oracle, SQL server, SharePoint and Business Objects.
• Highly motivated "self-starter" with the ability to exercise initiative, together with ability to work as a team player.
• 5+ years of operating experience of IT equipment and software with emphasis on Microsoft Office suite of products and SharePoint Designer and MS Project
• Experience customizing SharePoint.
• This position is open to US citizens only.
• Active Secret or higher clearance.
• DoDD 8140.01 IAT Level II Certification (Security+)

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
• Strong verbal communication skills and written communication skills
• Strong mathematical skills
• Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining
• Ability to create and maintain documentation of all development work
• Ability to effectively devote keen and acute attention to detail
• Ability to work consistently and effectively as part of a high-performance work team
• Ability to multi-task and perform multiple critical tasks simultaneously (under dynamic and ever-changing circumstances)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The work environment and physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required, sometimes for extended periods, to walk, stand, or sit. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. The employee is occasionally required to climb ladders or stairs; use hands to type, finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and get in and out of vehicles. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move small or large objects up to 50 pounds. #LI-KK1

General Information:
• Create and manage insightful Power BI reports and dashboards to drive data-driven decision-making.

Scope of Work:
• The Senior Power BI Developer will design, develop, and maintain advanced data visualization solutions using Microsoft Power BI.
• This role involves creating complex reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
• The developer will work closely with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements, build data models, and ensure data accuracy and performance.
• The ideal candidate will have strong experience with Power BI, DAX, and Power Query, and a deep understanding of data sources such as Oracle and SQL databases, Azure services, and APIs.
• Additionally, they will optimize data visualizations for clarity, efficiency, and scalability while ensuring security and compliance. Strong communication skills and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions are key.

Duties / Responsibilities:
• Design and build complex Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights for business decision-making.
• Create and optimize data models to support high-performance data visualizations, ensuring accurate representation of business metrics.
• Write and optimize advanced DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) queries and calculations to create dynamic and scalable measures.

The Office of Performance Analysis and Integrity manages and enhances the Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) which resides on one Oracle M8 Supercluster database and thirteen application servers. The candidate will oversee the design, development, implementation, and analysis of technical products and systems. Collaborating with business stakeholders, IT teams, and data engineers, you will help drive a data-driven culture while ensuring reporting solutions align with strategic objectives. At Hillenbrand, our culture of continuous improvement and innovation empowers associates to create meaningful impact, and as part of our team, you will contribute to Shaping What Matters For Tomorrow™ through the power of data. Develop interactive visual reports, dashboards, charts, and KPI scorecards using Microsoft Power BI Desktop. Analyze, design, deploy, troubleshoot, and support Power BI solutions. Participate in data analytics design reviews and create/deliver user training sessions. Oversee user acceptance testing to ensure solutions meet business needs. In lieu of degree 8 or more years of relevant experience A Master’s Degree or Data engineering certification (e.g, IBM Certified Data Engineer) is a plus Skills/Experience 5+ years of experience as a data engineer or in a related role within a global organization, with significant hands-on technology delivery experience. Minimum of 3 years of recent experience in custom Power BI development, including Power BI Report Builder, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Tabular Editor, ALM Toolkit, and DAX Studio, with expertise in writing complex DAX and SQL queries and implementing role-level security. A portfolio of previous work such as dashboards and reports examples, is required. Strong understanding of data modeling concepts, data schemas (normalized, flat, star, snowflake, etc.), and query optimization techniques. Familiarity with Power BI Embedded, Power BI REST API endpoints, and Power BI Premium Capacity. Title: BI Developer

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced BI Developer with Power BI experience to join our Enabling Technologies team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining data models/visualizations for strategic dashboards and reports serving key stakeholders such as Studio Executives, Financial leaders, Operational leaders, Project/Program Managers and Engineers. It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments; we're investing in the future of our firm's technology and building our team to provide the data insights necessary to accelerate our global growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to support our Global Private Client Group business. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Intelligence Developer will work with the BI Architects, Data Engineers, and other BI Developers on the team in designing and developing enterprise data models in our data warehouse used by our Private Client Group business. Our team extracts data from operational systems to our Azure Data Lake/Synapse environment, builds dimension and fact tables, and creates tabular models for use in Power BI. The scope of responsibilities will include eliciting requirements from various stakeholders, modeling the data into dimension and fact tables, implementation of tabular models, including DAX calculated measures and columns and securing the model through RBAC and roles. Responsible for operational support, incident investigation, and problem management, including logging, instrumentation, performance analysis, cross team collaboration, and process improvements. You will collaborate with the business on data visualization and report generation to meet reporting needs. You will report to the Business Intelligence Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
• Based on evaluation, recommend, implement, maintain, support, and improve business intelligence solutions, including designing, coding, testing, and deployment of datasets, data models, dashboards, and reports
• Independently manage product issues such as defects, patches, and upgrades, including deployment, testing, and post-production validation
• Define, guide, and deliver medium-to-large business intelligence projects from beginning to end, with guidance from BI Architects
• Test business intelligence solutions, including creating and implementing test plans/cases/scripts
• Provide operational support and incident management for assigned systems, including proactively update internal clients and relevant parties on status changes and issues encountered
• Author and maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for processes, procedures, and dashboard/report designs

Your Qualifications:
• 5+ years' experience with business intelligence methods and tools (Power BI)
• Advanced knowledge in programming languages such as SQL, R, DAX/MDX, or Python
• Experience with Azure Synapse, or equivalent cloud database technology
• Strong experience with tabular model design for large models in Analysis Services/Power BI
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience

Compensation:
• $85,000 - $135,000 base salary per year in the state of WA – New hires should expect to start at the lower end of the range depending on experience
• Eligible for a discretionary bonus based on firm and individual performance

Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
• 100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
• A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
• 20 days of PTO, plus 10 paid holidays
• Family Support programs including 8 week Paid Primary Caregiver Leave, $10,000 fertility, family forming, and hormonal health assistance, and back-up child, adult, and elder care
• This is an in-office role. Based on your role, tenure, and performance eligibility you may have the opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home program. This program is subject to change.
